AnRrxLkyHWTKu6gjSEvVFA.text: Best PHO in Charlotte!!!! Clean, Rich, flavored broth..spring rolls are delicious... staff are super nice.. if you want vietnamese food,  this Is the place to go

M-dv-rC15tjTvUORKsgCLQ.text: I am a pretty big fan of southeast asian food these days, so its nice to finally start finding more legit places in Charlotte.  I havn't been to Ben Thanh yet, so please excuse my ignorance for now.  Outside of the asian mall, this is where its at.  It ain't the prettiest thing from the outside, but Waaaaay more for real, than Pho real.  The broth is spot on.  First time I went was for lunch after a very late evening.  The absolute perfect hangover food.  And i havn't really strayed from the dish yet.  The pho has worked every time.  If these guys had Banh mi, I'd make it a weekly adventure.  Plan to start working on the rest of the menu soon, will update asap.  Word on the street is BYOB?  Havn't tried yet, but that could get interesting.

A8fv1iRUWXHwfZD1S4bVow.text: I thought I didn't like authentic Vietnamese food.  Then I tried VG.  This place is really, REALLY good. No doubt in my mind I'll be here weekly going forward... it's that good.

cdwrX_SwCH_G5P4x_FUhSQ.text: After reading all the reviews I had to give this place a shot. It definitely lived up to the hype. It was surprisingly slow for a Wed evening. We were seated immediately and out food came out amazingly fast. The food was great. It was too hot out for me to have Pho but definitely going back to try it.

iEJpERGiERsKjvqo8OYk1A.text: (2013) Absolutely love the rice vermicelli (pork in particular).  My wife (vegetarian) LOVES this place as well.    (2018) Having had Pho at other places in South Charlotte, I can say this place is the best.    I tried a traditional dish and found the shrimp overcooked (odd, because the shrimp in vermicelli or pho is done just right) and the rice was fair - I suspect this was a one time thing.   There's some vegetarian rolls there, has mint, tofu, with a dipping sauce - it's outstanding.    Their tofu is the best my wife's had anywhere.  My go-to place for Vietnamese food.

ycCNWd-LDeVn00A54WZuHA.text: Very nice greeting as soon as you walk in.  Just found out you can BYOB. Yup double checked with the waitress and she said it's ok.  Got #26 beef pho, very good and fresh.  I will come back

c5u-gM0F9-aPsAZRYa_BPg.text: I love Vietnamese food, especially pho. The food here is pretty good, the restaurant is nice and clean.    The service was extremely quick and the portions are big.  Overall, I enjoyed my experience; however, I would not say it's the best pho I've had in Charlotte. There are several places to enjoy Vietnamese cuisine in the Queen City.  While I thought Vietnam Grille was good, it's not my favorite.  For this reason, I gave Vietnam Girlle 3 stars.

jMsIBQvsF4A17FvJl5_mfw.text: I was on my own again for lunch and that's usually when I opt to try someplace new.  Today my choice was Vietnam Grille.  When I arrived the place was quite busy but I was seated at a single table way in the back (ok well its not a very big place so it wasn't that far of a walk).  The menu had a good variety of options and had descriptions underneath the items so you weren't at a total loss.  I ordered my old standby for Vietnamese places, Pho Ga.  I sweat the food was out in 5 minutes. I didn't even have time to sip my water (which is served with lime and is a nice touch).    The aroma of the soup is what caught me.  I want to say it smelled like a touch of cinnamon but I could be way off.  I just wanted to sit there and get high on the aroma for a while.  Finally i decided to season my soup with basil, lime, Siracha, Hoisson and Chili sauce.  Nothing like some spice to clear out the sinuses!  The soup was flavorful and I wanted to savor every drop.  The chicken was tender as well.  I think the aroma of the soup is better here but I'm still partial to Saigon Palace for the service (and the fact that they remember me there) but this is a good solid 4 stars and definitely worth a return trip!

_dCbhmV36KJDc78v58adcQ.text: This is hands down my favorite Vietnamese restaurant. I've been coming here about twice a week for the last 4 years. The service is prompt and the food is awesome! My favorite dishes are the rice vermicelli, crispy spring rolls, pork chops, vegetarian pho.... Ok I love everything on the menu. The building doesn't look like much on the outside but don't let that deter you from enjoying the best Vietnamese food Charlotte has to offer. I come during lunch and my food arrives in 5 minutes. Love love this place!!!!!!

b2DwDxscAkeXSGlNru04Ag.text: Food came out promptly. A lot quicker than other pho joints. The spring rolls were on the smaller portions. The pho broth had a bit too much cinnamon for our liking. Maybe it was a bad day or ? Will definitely come back to try the other dishes since my husband insisted their rice plates are more favorable.

tR5V_1i4jucEJfGERFK1cQ.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE. Their pork chops are the best! It reminds me of longanisa, but better! The waitstaff are polite and attentive. They are quick to refill or clear the tables. The owner is legit and kind! I swear he knows martial arts! I have a great time every time I walk into this establishment.

QvMD7zr8uG8PWx3NMDu0Iw.text: Good selection of Asian food. Average prices. Fast service.

yXMdlEcc-XWUMzwrmy8qFg.text: Great Vietnamese cuisines! Healthy as well they used healthy herbs that are really outstanding in terms of taste. Great Job guys!

hPqMl5uD1bihQUE8ehXyew.text: Great fresh food! Love Vietnamese food and this joint was my first Vietnamese find in Charlotte. Only downside is no lunch menu which left a heftier hole in my pocket. The portions are smaller than I would expect for the price.   Don't take the chopsticks though, even on accident or the owner will run out to the parking lot to get them back.

Su9SsdUdvd2cyMamPwr9Fw.text: I'm a regular of Vietnam Grille.  Vietnam Grille is a fast, inexpensive, and tasty meal.  They serve primarily Pho and Vermicelli with various meats.  One glaring hole in the menu is that they do not offer Banh mi sandwiches, which should now be standard at vietnamese restaurants.   Pros:  -Service is fast.  -Servers are accurate and friendly.  They seem to have the menu memorized by number. -Food is excellent and inexpensive.  Cons:    -Building is small.  When busy there might be a wait. -Parking is a bit of a hassle on South Blvd.  Ordinarily when I visit the Rent A Center that shares the lot is closed, you might have issues with parking if you go at lunchtime. -While ordinarily very friendly and nice, I have heard some of my friends complain that Rick Lai (the owner) calls customers out publicly for low tips.  Also I read/hear that he is hesitant to give refunds or allow staff to remake dishes if there is a customer complaint.  This might be a culture difference, but if True I find that to be unacceptable.

2ReZ7ECF_YJQ8-1JA9vAEg.text: I am visiting charlotte for work and found this place from yelp since it has a lot more comments than the other Vietnamese places. This place's interior is nicely done, clean and bright.  The price is consider high for pho and the portion is not that big.  The taste is fine, but not a lot of meat inside.  I have seen more non-Asians in this place than Asians when i was eating, that usually tells you it is probably not a very authentic pho place.   It is not a bad place, but I won't be back.

_Zah9Ifz3DzYumUEH9T_0w.text: Best seafood pho in Charlotte! They add enoki mushrooms and crawfish, yum.

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best seafood pho in Charlotte

zR3xmphWioRStpdzNGdJyA.text: Restaurants in shopping centers really can be a toss up. Try Vietnam Grille for fast, friendly and efficient service. Their pho was good for my soul and my sore throat. The fried pork egg roll was huge and very affordable. Pho runs around $9 and isn't gi-narmo like at some places. I could have downed the whole bowl in one setting but took some to go to savor the next day too.

_shTOil89tI0DQ2K58v1YA.text: #34 Crispy spring roll dish was EXCELLENT! It had little chopped up cucumbers under the noodles that were yummy. Crispy spring rolls delicious. First time here & really enjoyed it!

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. No. 34 Crispy spring rolls EXCELLENT!!

3M_l_imkjk_vdXLTzbraZA.text: This place is amazing. I have been seeing on Instagram that they offered vegetarian pho for a while and couldn't wait to go and try it.  We made dinner plans with some friends who frequented the place often so they knew ahead of time that we were able to bring in our own bottles of wine if we wanted to. We took in a couple of bottles of red which they gave us glasses and an opener for. The service was great, everyone who worked there was super attentive.  We had the vegetarian dumplings which had tofu and scallions in them and they were delicious. I ordered the vegetarian pho as my main entree and was in love. It had a wealth of vegetables and also tofu which was amazing, the broth was fantastic. This was my first time eating pho but I had been seeing it and it looked so good I couldn't help but get it. It was amazing and I will def. be going back for more. My husband ordered the tofu with lemongrass sauce and he also raved.  We can't wait to go back again.

KmNkJlPt6TZSdTALcjKJ3Q.text: This place is awesome!! A friend and I went last night. We eat had bun and I also did some take out for the boyfriend. The bun was fantastic; fresh, quick & the pork wasn't full of fat like it can be in some restaurants. Everything was clean & the restaurant progressively got more and more crowded as we ate. I've found my new Vietnamese spot!!

sxcq31CYsJqr_RnJrBb_Kw.text: Ricky was awesome!  He helped me order and chatted with me about the differences between Charlotte and the Northeast (he's from Philly orig and I'm here on biz from Boston).  He suggested the House Vermicelli and I also got Goi Con.  I took both back to my hotel room and loved them both.  I also took a generous amount of their hot chili garlic sauce and it's awesome.  I will definitely hit VG again when I'm in Charlotte.  Note: I jogged there from the Hilton Westpark, so if you don't have a car don't fret.

XjeIHZZNEXO9f_eAR1rqpA.text: This, I believe, is the best sit-down restaurant for Vietnamese food in Charlotte, based on the quality and taste of the food, the friendly service, and the decor.  The outside of the building is a little misleading: it looks like an old taco stand that's too close the road.  Once inside, however, one sees that it's got a simple, modern look to it, almost minimalist, with a warm, comfortable feeling.  And it's very clean looking.  Nice music played in the background.  I ordered a grilled pork dish with crab cake and rice, and the presentation was very good: it looked like art.  The smell from the grilled pork was phenomenal, the crab cake was terrific, and the dish was served with real broken rice as it is supposed to be done.  No corner cutting with sticky rice here.  Being naturally curious, I ordered a raw beef appetizer (bo tai chanh).  They weren't kidding.  I assumed It would be marinated in lime juice for hours, which cooks the meat in the enzymes like ceviche, if you've had that.  The meat should be whitish, not bloody.  When it arrived I couldn't eat it, however, because it was, well,  . . . raw.  We asked them to quickly cook the meat, which they did, and the spices still came through so it was tasty that way.  My friend had pho, and it had a pleasant taste with strong overtones of basil.  Both the man and the woman owners were super friendly--answering our questions about the music and the entrees.  We would go back there again in a heartbeat.

pVDRGEf-B5ok7-N0ZRjpfQ.text: Absolutely amazing - the best steamed dumplings I've had in AGES.  Pho was perfect as well.  Very clean, welcoming, and overall our new hands-down favorite Asian restaurant in Charlotte!

bsC0CsoL43pN9Q8bsFjDwA.text: This is the best Vietnamese food in Charlotte.  All the ingredients are fresh.  The Bun is highly recommended.  A group of us at work try to eat there at least once a week.

-PN3dpv6kM7tFimdb9ID5A.text: We're big fans of this unassuming restaurant located in a dreary parking lot in South Charlotte.  The owners are friendly and efficient, and kindly looked away as we ordered number 15 on the menu and fumbled to make our own spring rolls.  It was loads of fun...it comes with pork, chicken, and beef, and you get to soak your own rice paper and try your hand at rolling something tight enough to eat with chopsticks, and if you fail, well it still tastes great.  The peanut sauce is divine.

21bD07LNritK7J1T1KGIBw.text: I constantly crave their pho! It hits the spot on a cold winter day. Far superior to some other places I've tried. I really enjoy their spring rolls too. I haven't really tried anything else here.

GRwuqX24R4S2nOrnuT4KNQ.text: This place is great for pho! It's closer than my regular place and the service is always nice. I normally just do the pho and I have never been disappointed.

Y1HXo2Dh5EFRlYDznBdvGw.text: I am very surprised this place is doing well. My experience there was horrible. I had their specialty rice plate and it was horrible. My boyfriend got the pho Dac biet and he said it was just full of msg. This is literally how our food came out. The hose/server took our order down and when she went to stand behind the counter to put the order in. The cook/server brought our food out. I'm assuming he heard our order from the back and prepared it quickly for us. The restaurant was dead so there shouldn't be a rush or delay in our food...  The rice plate I ordered had grill beef and grilled shrimp on skewers...Now how did this guy grill it so quick to be plated already?? Well.. its because it was pre grilled and just microwaved. The whole plate tasted like it was just microwaved and sent out asap.   So disappointing how these asian restaurants are fooling the americans of Vietnamese food that should be good but isnt. American's don't know any better so they are served what they think is good but its crap... Fooling people for their money is wrong..   Well I forsure won't be trying this place again and I hope you fellow yelpers try some PHO Cali on S Tryon st. They are way better in quality of food and everything else.

V3Q4CAiR-6YsbAaECS_zNw.text: Among the best Vietnamese Food I've ever eaten. Priced very well for the amount of food you get! Excellent service. Definitely 5 Stars!!! I'll be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

YMzLIQ0GkmNz5z3dBF_LBA.text: Vietnamese Grille is my favorite Vietnamese spot in Charlotte. It is casual, but fast and delicious! I have called in many takeout orders on my way home, and my order is typically ready within 10 minutes. My favorite items are the Shrimp and Pork rolls, steamed dumplings, Chef Special Bun (yum!!), and Pho! I have also sat in restaurant a few times. It is not glamorous, but it is comfortable. They don't have alcohol on the menu, however you can bring your own with you, if you like!

lx2NYl001A-UJ0lqRjE1lg.text: Try the Pho once and you will be a repeat customer. They do it right plain & simple. The broth is super clean, flavorful and satisfying. No alcohol service as FYI. Try the lime aid.

t7qfOiN4XHMh4GJ3m8_BYw.text: Didnt care for it wife thought it was ok....plain noodles everywhere....too damn spicy too

DjfU9tjl5sqI2RoVFQJAGA.text: My favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Charlotte. The staff treats me like family and always helps if I have questions and pushes me out of my comfort zone.  You can't go wrong with the #4, 27 and 33.

WGE3-e0hi7wSx2lXKGZZZg.text: Wow-what a fabulous meal we had here! We started with the spring rolls, which came out hot, crispy and delicious. For dinner I had two appetizers: #4 and #6 (grilled shrimp skewers and rice vegetable  & mint wraps) which were equally delicious. My husband had #33; full of fresh vegetables, light but flavorful vermicelli noodles, chicken, shrimp, and pork. All cooked to perfection. Our only disappointment was that there was too much to finish, and we couldn't take it  home.

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spring rolls
Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled shrimp skewers
Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

roOJegpd4gcQi1VWUy71gA.text: Great food.  Minus 2 stars for being ridiculous.  Ordered iced tea and they wanted to know if I wanted sweet or unsweetened.  "Can I get half and half" I asked.  "No", said the waitress, "we don't do that."  Seeing that I was puzzled, the owner came over and said "we don't do that because it's a big problem when we give someone half and half and it's too sweet or not sweet enough."  I guess if he considers that a big problem, he's lucky because he doesn't have any real problems.  I ordered water with my food.  Shrimp and pork spring rolls are delicious.  I recently returned and am happy to say they will now serve you half and half tea. Excellent food and service at a reasonable price.

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and pork spring rolls - tasty

FbsaiaggANMQULU7-_h_Bg.text: The service was immediately great! I went here today during lunch so it was busy, but 3 different employees asked if we'd been helped. They're super attentive.   My friend & I both got #50 on the menu. It was a broken rice dish w lemongrass chicken, meatballs, shrimp, & something friend. Every single thing was very flavorful! I wanted to get the recipe so I could do it at home myself lol.

3VHIxgorurVODTU6aAzwUw.text: The vegetarian pho is the second best I've had in Charlotte. Viet Thai is slightly better, but the standard dishes here surpass Viet Thai's stir fry, so it's almost a wash overall. Also, their service is excellent - do not be deterred from the outside; it is fine once you venture in. Definitely worth a stop and is one of the better places to eat on South Blvd.

gA_-_e4uISH7FKhhBvYbcg.text: I've enjoyed this place since I was introduced to Pho a couple years back. I've tried other resturaunts but always keep coming back to this one. The broth is great and their portion sizes are perfect/generous. Other items such as noodle bowls with grilled chicken are great as well. Appetizers such as thr shrimp summer rolls and the steamed dumplings are awesome. Definitely reccommend checking this place out if you haven't.

Bcdn9gFOrYuLR3kZZkvf4w.text: I had the veggie pho. I thought it was okay due to different sorts of veggies in the pho compare to other places. The broth was a bit too salty for my taste but I guess thats where you add a pack of sugar to balance it out. Shall give it another try in the future.

5ZmAEE4nqrHQsZFFBnfGTQ.text: I loved this place. My husband dined here for the first time yesterday and insisted on bringing me back tonight. What a treat!  Food was wonderful, our server was very pleasant and helpful, and the prices were reasonable. I can't wait to come back!

ZlK5sNpSgy-O9OmgHI_hlg.text: Vietnam Grille gives me tummy-wood every time I go there.  Is the food good you ask?  Pho shizzle!  Vietnamese dining is generally a light and fresh experience...and the VNG always comes through with well balanced flavors.  Each spice speaks for itself without overpowering the others in all of the dishes I've tried.  The prices are very reasonable and the service is excellent.  Recommend:  The Pho (Not for the chopsticks novice)  Slurp away!

hoSneBxWqvSB5yi1YP_EMw.text: This place is not even a vietnamese restaurant!! Ordered their pork chop rice dish, I was so disappointed taste was very bland. No fixins came with it like a typical place and the fish sauce wow mehh?? My coworker tried the pho.. Lets just say "*instant"* tastes even better than this!!

btucIGzP4PnJX0Bn7fjIyA.text: It's virtually impossible to leave here unhappy. Talk about delicious and authentic! And affordable at that!

PlvmxsvdC1XuhqfW__6jwA.text: I'm in the midst of trying to make my way around the world with food... There's so much out there that I haven't tried and I just can't be content with that any longer... My first foray into the unknown was at the Vietnam Grille...  The staff was really helpful... As soon as I walked in, I was greeted warmly... I let them know I had no idea what to order... We shared a laugh and I told them I knew that everyone keeps talking about their Pho, so I went for it... They also suggested the crispy spring rolls as another good option for a novice, so I took an order of those as well...  I settled on the Pho Ga... I noticed the rice noodles in the bag, so I put those in the broth and went to town...   It was absolutely divine... NOW I get what the hubbub is about... The spring rolls were great... Crisp and filled with well-spiced pork...  Fabulously done...   Full disclosure?  I didn't realize there was another little take out box of stuff inside the bag to go in the Pho, so I missed the whole bean sprouts, fish sauce, herbs, lime (?) and jalapenos until the very end! lol Once I added those, it completely changed the flavor... It was still yummy... I wish I had known that from the beginning, though! lol Next time I get food from a region that I'm unfamiliar with, I'll make sure to take home some instructions as well...   There are quite a few other things on the menu that looked intriguing as well, so join me in welcoming Vietnam Grille to my restaurant rotation... :)

OOQUUvAOvs9B9VJNcPEnPA.text: Fantastic. Coworker brought me here to try it out. I now find reasons to bring new people tothis restaurant and introduce them to the pho, rice wraps, broken rice plates, and my fav, #34.

3KmBBBi01fyN6j_xpV1jKw.text: Horrible!!!! The portions are tiny for overpriced bland vietnamese food and to top it off the waitress spilled soup all over my shoes. Horrible experience! Do not go there

HRpg9opd9toyiE-gN8WIUw.text: Went here actually twice this week with co-workers and it did not disappoint.  The service was great and they were very attentive to ours needs.  Portion size for the cost were very reasonable.  The food tasted great and the special hot sauce definitely had a nice kick to it.  According to my co-workers the Pho was awesome, I myself had the number 33.  Very good and the shrimp was perfectly cooked.  This is another one of those locations that if you order soda it comes in a can, and expensive.  Water with lime is the way to go.  I would definitely recommend and return to this location.

hw7HQvBen1eG9vwzZlUVGA.text: Review of Vietnam Grille - Well, the food and atmosphere are nice. The place is very clean and accessible. The staff seem friendly. Two coworkers and I arrived at a slow time (only one other table is occupied). One of us asks the "chef" what he recommends, and we can't get an answer other than to try the "sampler appetizer plate," which was also the most expensive thing on the menu. Long story short, the food was decent, but nothing special. Better fare at the Siagon Palace. Lastly, it took 25 minutes from the time we asked for the check to the time we finally were able to leave! that is just ridiculous.  Unless something occurs to change our minds, we probably won't be going back.

naSZ-1NkAr6UmMiwtjXUCw.text: OMG I love this place! Vietnamese grape leaves have to be my favorite new food find.  This place is so addicting I ate here three times last week and I'm already wanting some more.  The service is fast and friendly.  If you like Vietnamese give this place a try.

VrQk2B7EkvnMsgxF2ECWHw.text: Amazing.  This place is brand new and the chef (that's right chef and not cook) is from Philly.  Its right off South Blvd, but don't let the Korean cleaner type building fool you.  The inside is quiet trendy and CLEAN.    Try the spring rolls, dumplings, and stuffed grape leaves.  Yes I am fat now.  I also tried to Pho, which tasted strange at first (because no MSG), but wonderful.  All the dishes used fresh vegetables, and the chef even came out to say hello.  Plus, I could understand!!!    Skip Pho 98 that is next door, and come here.  You won't regret it, and your wallet will thank you.

TaW8IZz4Dez8VFTC7s7D6A.text: I decided to try this place based on everyone reviews and love it. Granted I always get the same thing. The #26 Pho Tai  Sliced flank steak rice noodle soups. Love the condiments.

SpnyqtwIKVFUb9MzmKnlTw.text: OK yum!  This place just opened 3 weeks ago.  Not a lot of people in there when we went late afternoon... but boy oh boy was the food good!  The owner came to our table and told my sister and me all about the history of their restaurant.  His parents started a very sucessful restaurant in Philadelphia and then his brother opened another in the area along with a bar.  He and another brother moved to NC because they liked the area and decided to open their own place.  The cool thing is the high standard of quality of food that they brought with them from Philadelphia.  You can actually taste it in the quality of ingredients.  So very yummy!  Also, the cleanliness and friendliness is second to none.  Check this place out, it is truly yummy!

jG1wajVYQX0iVZ_Ey4btsA.text: Was a fan of VG since it's opening. Hadn't been in a while and was craving the soup with the shrimp cracker floating on top. The broth which normally smells like perfume to me was bland and nothing special. A few weeks later, I was told by a Vietnamese person that Rick is no longer the owner. Go figure. Probably won't be back.

Dp7jdDhzVsgzb8kJeU_Uig.text: Great vermicelli (try the house speciality mixed version) and decent pho. Fresh ingredients, very fast and nice, attentive staff  (water was filled about five times during the quick meal). I will definitely be back!

TnSV6eosMJTuUxsUBWzSlA.text: This place is outstanding every time.  We always get a vermicelli dish (bun).  They have no problem letting you mix and match--for example chicken shrimp and spring roll.  Vietnamese food is so easy to eat, I could eat here several times a week.

59OGvGrFG9N_71QlFfafKQ.text: NEVER AGAIN! I went there for lunch today...$13 with tax and tip later for a bowl of pho and iced tea and I ask for a tea to go. The server brings me what I can only assume is the smallest to go cup ever manufactured. On my way out, I see that the staff is using larger to go cups for their own drinks. I ask for a larger cup and they tell me they brought there own. Now, I ask, exactly how effin' stupid do they think I am??? Saigon Palace and Doan's will receive my business from now on.

6BVZlJ3ICTPoNM_Z1QimGA.text: I'm so tired of being stereotyped here. Don't ask me if i know wtf pho is or if I  know what's in it? Especially if I can pronounce what I'm ordering. Do honestly believe I would eat here alone if it where my first visit? I like the food here but my last few visits have been less than pleasant with the staff. It's time to find somewhere else.

wpYCwJ15e1Wl-TqC7umzaQ.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants. The atmosphere is very soothing and comfortable. The noise level is very low and their decor is nice. I've come here a total of 3 times: once with a friend, once with parents and once by myself. I always start off with their shrimp and pork spring rolls. Love love love them! Their phos not the best but they're not bad. I usually get their rice vermicelli with char-grilled pork, which is delicious!

CLZbIcLYKkrRrbphpj1C0A.text: Service is great, food is phenomenal. Try the grilled pork rolls and the pho tai nam. You won't be disappointed! CT runs a great show.

TORlDQlHosFhrXpErdoksQ.text: Talking about a hole in the wall... yeah, yeah, yea... the Pho is great and the owner is very nice... BUT: the Vermicelli is to die for! I tried the house special as well as the pork and both were excellent. Just the right amount of each ingredient, mixed with just the right amount of sauce. I'll be back often!

6xJrVpfChyo6KAcJKPOznw.text: The chicken over broken rice tastes no so good as before, especially the rice. I'm not sure if they change the chef, but I really see some different people there.

Eqrs_lFMJ0OOgSYC98yPjw.text: A great place for Pho. I always order the Pho with Tripe and it's delicious. The service is good and the food comes out fast. I have tried the Spring  Rolls and was disappointed. They were not very flavorful and greasy. I stick with the Pho and I am always satisfied.

6cScEpAv65Uio_rwBCJK9A.text: Delicious meatball fresh rolls. Fast and friendly service in a surprisingly clean and pleasant environment, despite the exterior. Wife's tofu was yummy.  Good healthy options that even my 6 year old loved.

hAJoR9YrTDEAzn55tfFpPw.text: The food and service was phenomenal! I went with my parents, who had been to Vietnam and they said it was as good, if not better than the food they had there. I had the Ban pork and my husband had the broken noodles and my parents had the Pho. All were delicious!! I can't wait to go back.

shJbs3aUMUDsB8NK7KlCGw.text: Fast service & good big bowls of delicious pho. Salad rolls were fresh and average size however personally i prefer more veggies in mine. Peanut sauce was a little too sweet.

6o_VkRiINIDJldLsnGAGBA.text: Ate here last night with hubby and kiddo. The best meal I have had in Charlotte, equal to any Vietnamese place in the San Francisco area or Honolulu, which are my points of comparison.  The vegetarian spring rolls are fresh and the dipping sauce is handmade, not some goop from a jar. I had pork over broken rice and my husband had a grilled chicken dish, both had a nice balance of heat and were not overly sweet-- as so many Asian dishes are made to suit the American (and southern) palate.  The service couldn't have been nicer, they were prompt and friendly and the overall tab was very reasonable. We will be back soon!

OBy38GzfPRq602eaIyazXg.text: this place is legit. i have a smattering of vietnamese friends who frequent this establishment, and i go where the natives go. ya' dig?  i won't say much that has already been said here, but i have only one complaint. are they skimpy on the amount of noodles they put in your bowl? i've been to other places, and i feel like i've gotten more noodles than what i've had here. i know that i share my pho with my daughter, but even then--there's not a lot left. the broth is super delicious, but i like to fill up on the starch and the meat mostly. report back yelpland.

_FoqrMIVK7lm-vgri3d6Vg.text: Even better than any vietnamese restaurant in the midwest. This place really is good.  They had some very americanized items on the menu, that I haven't even seen in Vietnam, but the quality of what we did eat was pretty on par with what you would find a True Vietnamese restaurant in the U.S. We brought friends from the area who had never tried the food and they love it and go back regularly.

D_LY1l2H4rVUrkXwbM1Tyg.text: First time eating Vietnamese.  Very good food, attentive staff. Definitely will come back

OmFfWP6uVzTi1oAzRPKGGQ.text: Food is super fresh. I got flank steak Pho. The flavors were unreal.  My wife got the Chicken Bun, which had a great taste and different textures. The best part is we ate dinner for under $20.  It was a great deal for the $$.

GZZmOkInL4VlAkRqeMXIKw.text: I am a big fan of Southeast Asian cuisine but I am supper picky as well. Many place have a tendency to bastardize Asian cuisine but this place does a great job of keeping it authentic as well as making it approachable to westerners. Super clean in restaurant and not overly decorated...which added to the relaxing vibe. Best beef pho in town!

YLp2W7mZMdWQTcgOICpSNQ.text: Who knew that authentic Vietnamese food from North Carolina would be this amazing.

X5wO_ASD_C2Bb90BvN9aFw.text: I love the char-grilled pork in the Bun. Use to work close by and been there numerous times and never disappointed. Service is very efficient and friendly- just regret I don't work close by any longer.

1loB_nHqqUoMcKYaPKjXeg.text: How many times am I allowed to review the same place?  Third time's a charm...  Fried spring rolls:  excellent. 5 year-old daughter chowed on them. Accompanied by lettuce, cilantro, pickled carrots/radishes and dipping sauce (would it be terribly rude to drink it?).    A couple of weeks ago I tried the rare beef salad from the appetizer menu. Wow. Not for the faint at heart, but I enjoyed this. It really *is* rare. Seasoned to perfection, topped with crushed peanuts and some greenery (I'm going from memory here--probably green onions and/or cilantro). Accompanied by lime wedges, marinated carrots/radishes and dipping sauce.   I did have a side bowl of their marvelous pho--a visit wouldn't feel right without it. :-)  The most important thing about Vietnam Grille (besides the pho)  is that they pay attention and they care.  They care about your choice of food and how you liked it. They remember you when you come back (months later!). They help you try something different.  That makes all the difference in the world between a place you merely like and a place that comes to mind every week.

yIz2RPxrfdgMbG74PqpB2A.text: The pho broth was very good.  The grilled pork fresh rolls were overly expensive at 5.95 for how big they were, particularly as the chicken ones were 4.75. The grilled pork was very, very dry. It had decent flavor but it was hard to tell because they were cooked way too much. They were tiny also, but overall flavorful.  The meat for the pho tai was more cubed than it was thinly sliced.  The broth was heavy with lime and the smell of cloves. Very little, if any, cilantro in the soup's base. The noodles were good and came apart easily.  Overall pretty good. I would come again but I wouldn't order rolls.

yE2z4WZ4YOOC6_8CsEmfyw.text: Love love love this place. I was so pleased that everything was so fresh and expertly prepared.  Everyone was over the top friendly!  It's about a mile from my house, so they'll be seeing a lot more of me in the future!

pmLP-iXXzkltCnLYIJPWIg.text: I'm in love!  Its hard to find vietnamese food here in Charlotte.  Man, am I glad I followed the recommendation for Vietnam Grille.  Long story short, I've loved everything I've gotten from here.   The bun, the pho ga, the rolls, the dumplings:  all well crafted, fresh, and tasty.  I might be addicted.

dLpoRMOrDHYgIEcHik-Bsw.text: Awesome! Clean, fresh and delicious. Get the pho, some of the best I've had.

IEsHMrYjpW08IjiPOoaIvw.text: Absolutely amazing Vietnamese food. Fresh, clean ingredients. Complex flavors. Nice staff. Reasonably priced.

se1zHZ4hrVVno3SaYXAIcg.text: Great food and meat selection. Go for the spring rolls.

zhtxd_NCRjlEYBzCxaPkzg.text: Best Vietnamese in Charlotte...hands down. I've tried a good portion of the menu so here are my thoughts.   Appetizers Recommended:  - tofu rolls, chicken and shrmp rolls, sauteed squid (awesome), stuffed grape leaves.  Misses: dumplings (why get dumplings at a Vietnamese restaiurant anywy), chicken salad (average).  Pho Just go down the list...chicken pho, tendon, tripe, flank stteak...all are phenomenal. Seasoned perfectly so give it a taste before you grab the siracha or hot chili oil. I would recommend paying the extra buck or two for additional meat - and it's easily two meals.  Bun Another home-run...the pork meatball is out of this world...typically get that with spring roll and maybe add another meatball...whoosh!  Other Rice dishes are really good, catfish stew/soup was awesome, vegetarian dishes are solid, etc.  Ricky and Tommy are the guys you'll encounter both in the kitchen and front of house....super nice guys, tons of experience in the business and generally care that their customers are happy (sometimes a little bit overbearing but I can live with it)!   Don't be scared off by the neighborhood....it's worth the visit!

kfM4XbOYe5s5j7f40SBVrQ.text: Lower prices than most of the other family-owned Vietnamese joints in town... but this place is not up to snuff for vegetarians.  Two of the six entrees that are veg-friendly are sauteed greens. The other four are all slight variations on the tofu and vegetable theme, some with noodles, some with rice... blah.   The goi cuon app we shared was passable, but not nearly as exciting as others I've had. Classic case of what happens when you tone down the flavors in this particular dish: you end up with a mouth full of rice paper, rice noodles, and bland tofu. There has to be a lot of herbs to brighten that mother up, and there were maybe two or three slivers of thai basil to be found.  Of course, this was all compounded by my roving eyes; everyone else was happy (and all were ordering pho). The bowls and plates being delivered to the other tables looked tantalizingly tasty. So ya, I'm obviously missing the boat due to my lurv for the animalz.  So there you have it:  the veg side of Vietnam Grille is dissapointingly close to boring ol' chinese stir fry. Maybe they'll beef (heh) up their selection one day, but 'till then, I'll stick to LV and BT.

RFzaxpRDOV2h7Ct1fnLn6g.text: On a whim my wife and I dropped in a few weeks ago. I think we have been back four or five times since then. The food is amazing, the space clean and simple and the service nice. Great Pho and soups, lots of vegetarian options for my wife and the grilled squid was one of the best presentations we have had. We don't write many reviews but this place deserved a good one.

D_ZXjiSHrQObBoBPVPDfbQ.text: It was my third order - the first two orders on Chicken Pho noodle soup - they prepared it very very well for a take out, the broth - excellent and brothy.  Now this time - I'm baffled, it didn't turn out well. I haven't dined in yet.  Overall, I could not really figure what went wrong. Maybe it's bad timing (yet absolutely NO excuse)? However, the waitress who took my order was very friendly and the amount of time waiting for my take-out order was FAST. I'll give this place one more try before I finalize my decision.

En6LRpd7TCGeTJ8ehC_Rdg.text: I had high expectations for this place but honestly it's not great. It's overpriced for the quality of the food. I ordered dumplings and lemongrass tofu in a to-go order and when I arrived they said something about not having lemongrass tofu... but still gave me my meal. Then when I arrived home and checked my food I saw that they gave me spring rolls instead of dumplings. The rice that came with my meal was good but the tofu was not. It was bland. There are better options less than a mile away; go to Saigon Palace instead of this mess.

5nELfD6h9nJhSA6qNOqz3Q.text: Wow Delicious - not what I had expected. Plus they give you soon much food!!  Best tip about this place: quick and speedy for those on their lunch break.

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. #33 - no shrimp, sub veggies!
Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. menu
Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. #33

No-Jc7gcQ-gI1Cb-e_1wZA.text: I came here not expecting anything as I had never heard of it and wanted some "semi-authentic" Vietnamese food. I was wonderfully surprised. My food was great. I ordered the vegetarian pho (which had a warm, Christmas morning type of flavor). My waiter said that it takes hours just to make the broth and everything in the restaurant is made from scratch. The spring rolls were fresh and absolutely wonderful. I've been back 4 or 5 times since and order the same thing every time to go. They actually remember my order when I come in. If I had to find a negative, the building looks a bit shabby - but I assure you that the food is wonderful. This is now my favorite Vietnamese in the city.

FXyyuUAgTAAszDLR_r74Yw.text: This place looks a bit run down, but the food was actually pretty good. Their spring rolls were really good, very crispy and fresh. The flavor of the pho soup was very good too, clean and balanced. I've eaten at many authentic pho places in LA, this place is not the best I've had, but is definitely comparable.

-J8ZhRQRLX8361OS3Hj0Wg.text: My other two favorite Pho spots were either closed or too far away so I gave this a shot.  the service was great, portion size, cleanliness, price - everything was on point.  What I didn't like may be more a flavor preference - there was WAY too much star anise in the broth flavoring than I prefer.  I adore a good bone broth and this just wasn't it for me. If you want to private message me, I can offer you my favorites and my not-so favorites in the Charlotte area.  This is neither near nor there for me, but would go again if I was without other options.  And praise Baby Jesus in a Golden Fleece we finally have plenty of pho options in this town!!!!!

AljYbj0f5XyhefMKDLC9Gg.text: Excellent Pho with a good portion of beef and tendon. I love Pho with tendon and if that is your cup of tea... this place will not disappoint! There were also plenty of slices of jalapeno to put in the bowl... which I love. The broth did not require any sriracha or hoisin, and that is saying something! Service was excellent.

gDIfOtEH730yAqo5B4xywg.text: Great food.  Homemade and it you will know it!  Great portions at a reasonable price.  Cannot go wrong.

MOZbJ5ordIjSclhANlM3yQ.text: I'm giving this restaurant a 3 stars because it really fails my standard expectations of a Vietnamese restaurant.  Let's start with pros: - I only ordered to go but the staff was courteous and service was prompt. - the restaurant was clean.  Cons: - I ordered "com tam" which is a rice dish. However, when I opened my box after I left the restaurant, I found myself with rice noodles instead of rice. Weird. Don't know if they ran out of rice or something. But a heads up would have been appreciated.  - I ordered the spring rolls to go. It says 2 pieces for $5. I opened my box and it was TINY TINY rolls. Like the regular size cut in half.  Disappointment.

X9DUjCW4o-WCyaXYYsJvog.text: Don't hate me. Love me. BUT--I don't see the big deal about Pho.  All I heard about was Pho this and Pho that and so I was so eager to try it out!!  Basically, I didn't think it was all that.  Basically, I thought it was like Chicken soup on steroids.  A few extra bells and whistles but at the end of the day, broth with noodles and some meat.  Seriously, am I wrong?  Help me understand!    I will say that a friend ordered one of the curry dishes and it looked so good and so fresh.  I was panting all over her dish because my Pho wasn't cutting it.    The chicken spring rolls with peanut sauce were ON POINT!!!  I wish I made a meal out of just those bad boys.  They were so good and that peanut sauce was euphoric.  Amazing.    I love that you can BYOB, the prices are right and the service was friendly.  I will come back but not for Pho.

-WRk_t73epSejziflOn6eA.text: Sigh.  VG, we're through!  Sure, we had some good times - but sadly, I always thought I could do better.  That was definitely a sign that I should've left earlier.  We tried to work through it because after all, I love pho and you serve pho.  Love at first bite.  But you know what you did...it was a DEAL-BREAKER in my book!  And no, those aren't tears wept for days gone by, no, these tears are freedom tears. (?)  I'm no longer under your spell.  Time pho me move on and pho-getaboutchu.  You still don't know what you did?  You want me to take you back?  Sorry, I've moved on.  It was 8:45PM on a chill Friday night and my sister was in town.  Destroyed mentally, physically, spiritually, financially, and (insert another adverb) after a rough Thursday night, a few of us decided to play it low-key and hit up VG for some pho and call it a night.  My heart skipped a beat.  It always does when I think of you, VG.  Imagine my shock when YOU WOULDN'T LET ME IN AT 8:45PM DESPITE THE SIGN SAYING YOU'RE OPEN UNTIL 9PM.  LET ME IN (giggle) How dare you.  You know me, service is everything.  Having worked in customer service, for well, my entire working life, this kinda stuff is unacceptable.  Think of the disappointment you cause...    I want to go on a Michelle P-esque rant right here.  But I'm all cried out, I mean, it's not worth my time.  Your pho is nice, but I've seen better.  Your spring rolls?  It's okay but everyone's got some.  No beer?  Yeah, we ain't hanging out sober.   We had a good run... you and I.  But change is a part of life.   WTF, Dan, are you going on a 4-month vacation?  BECAUSE IT LOOKS LIKE YOU GOT A LOT OF BAGGAGE.  Is this review even about a restaurant?  dmo out

Tl7CnBqY4x9bufiUusiKbA.text: Great find. Glad I followed the reviews to find this gem. We shared the crispy rolls - ground meat wrapped in rice paper and deep fried. Hot like fire; burning your mouth but delicious. They come so hot you want to eat them fast but you can't. Light dipping sauce, small amount of fresh veggies and lettuce leaves. I wrapped mine in lettuce to tame the heat. I would get these again. I got the beef pho and man candy got the chicken pho. The beef was very strongly spiced with cinnamon and star anise. More than I was expecting and I've had pho before. The chicken was mild, nice large pieces of white meat. Both served with generous toppings plate: Thai basil, sprouts, jalapeno and lime wedges. All fresh, no wilted veg here. Sodas are canned, man candy says, "good coke, good ice" and "those little fried things were good". Overall, awesome meal under $30.
