VZ3l5ntUla_q6oPq-rQx8w.text: Unbelievable! I don't understand how this place has so many good reviews. I was the only customer in the restaurant, which should've been a red flag. My experience was terrible. I ordered jackfruit bubble tea, and received jackfruit blended with ice and no tapioca. The vermicelli was accompanied by bland fish sauce which I guess is why some of you can slurp it... And stuffed with veggies and little meat. The meat was flavorless and the service was poor.   Well, safe to say, this Vietnamese restaurant is not for Vietnamese people. I got YELPED!

snwkBEsxPWXH2D7ryZt2Og.text: We ordered to go. Pork chop tasted ok, bit salty, but not fully cooked in the . middle part. Fresh spring rolls were expensive. The length of their spring rolls is definitely half the size of what they sell in CA. The fried egg rolls have unidentifiable contents. Looked like ground meat of some kind, over fried and turned powdery when we took a bite of it. Overall, thumbs down

NvLPC-ny7D6ATiQWALiaCQ.text: I can't wait to go back! I've been dreaming of the tofu wraps ever since we left.  We got two plates of wraps and two bowls of Pho and split between 4 people. We had a whole meal left over for each of us afterwards. SOOOO much food!  This place is a hole in the wall, but seriously, if you are anywhere nearby, GO there!

p5AWQRvjidtJFAfcNmBbTg.text: Think about a place that makes you feel at home....vg does that for you. Comfortable surroundings, great servers, and delicious food. The pho, house vermicelli (with egg on top is a must), and curry are great! If your a sauce person like I am you will be ecstatic because the table is stacked. Oh boy...  The staff will start to recognize you when you go enough and provide you with things that aren't on the menu. If you enjoy great food, low prices, and did I say great food...then head over.

lPIyUL2kEfjcuOcGikw-Uw.text: This place doesn't look like much (used to be a Jersey Mike's), but some of the most amazing ethnic restaurants never do.  I love some of the menu items, like the raw flank steak and grilled calamari appetizers... you don't see that on many menus.  The Pho is good, not the best, but I still get it every time.  The owner/chef is awesome.  He has been out to talk to us every time I have been there.  I haven't been back in while, but they used to allow you to bring your own bottle of wine (no fee).    I recommend this place for a good, inexpensive dinner.

_kUF9FymyIRqzQJOadZbXQ.text: Very delicious place!!! I went there for a lunch break and it was great. The place isn't fancy, but the food is wonderful. I had shrimp and pork steamed dumplings, was very yummy and fresh. I also had chicken soup and it tasted great. The service was very decent too, friendly and took care of me.

g3x-1C65J1ExhSIIhtocfw.text: We were in town recently and had to try Vietnam Grille due to the high ratings. It was so lovely at lunch- we went back for dinner.   All in all, we sampled the seafood pho, beef pho, crispy spring rolls, grilled squid, stewed catfish, & a huge bowl of bun! It was all fabulous- if I lived in town- I think I'd go at least once a week, but there was a guy at the table next to us who eats there every day!   Anyway- it's a cool little place in a kinda ho-hum location, but the food & service will knock your socks off.

TTEhrpGwM7d8MRXrFAnaYQ.text: Ordered Spring rolls, and Stir-Fry Chicken with Rice-noodles.  The rolls were good but the chicken had no flavor whatsoever.  Ben Than and Lang Van are much better to be honest.  This place was way overpriced.  Paid $25 and then the owner complained to me that I didn't leave a tip that was 15%....who does that?  It's none of your business how much tip I prefer to leave!  Rude! So much for trying a new place.....I'll stick with my favorites: Ben Thanh & Lang Van!

r6V4548PuaJlg3oq1CSWnA.text: Haven't had Vietnamese in years, but was not disappointed by Vietnam grille. Staff was attentive and helpful. Food was served quickly. Fresh spring rolls were good value for money, and tasty. Pho was fresh and flavorful, but could use a bit more "sauce" (which is what I'm used to). This a great little fast-food viet joint! You are served quickly and in a friendly manner, which always works for those on the run. I will not hesitate to return, especially at lunch time, since that is a busy time of day for me.  I also think this would be a great take out place, though I haven't used it that way yet. I saw several patrons come and go with big parcels of food. The decor is ordinary, but that's fine since fast food is not dependent on decor.

2MBMAbBO1Hh3bkamayiJ_Q.text: I am half Vietnamese and my mom makes amazing food. This place feels like home! Authentic and delicious!!! Must try!! Best Vietnamese food in Charlotte. Best Vietnamese in North Carolina!

C4-XgdK82sdfZuZzGc3FeA.text: Normally we hit Saigon palace when were looking for pho in charlotte, but it's time we branched out and started looking to see what else is out there, especially since the palace is not the greatest pho.   Yelping this place with an overwhelming 70+ reviews which outpaced other viet restaurants in the area, I had my hopes up but didn't let my expectations get too lofty.  Man did this place disappoint big time. Everyone got a bowl of pho. And what I got was an expensive (9.25 for a regular size bowl is outrageous in any area of the country besides Charlotte for some reason) watery bowl of nothingness.  Meat  completely non existent. Veggies sparse.  Noodles even lacking which is usually used to replace lack of meat.  Meat was overcooked and not a beautiful medium rare. I tried to enhance the watery bowl of pho by asking for some fragrant nuoc beo but obviously this place did not have it. That means they either cook the pho with pho flavored cubes or beef broth cans with lean meat and not huge stock bones with lots of fat.  I recommend every pho loving person avoid this place at all costs.

fLe3kRC5-7400aiUCnLPwg.text: Writing this post based on quality - not personal preference.  Veggie pho had cinnamon which I thought was so weird and gross. Had a dish that included chicken and garlic and white rice. Didn't love the flavor of that either.  However, the service was great and the food itself was cooked and prepared awesome as well. I do not give bad reviews just because of how I thought it tasted  I do think that cinnamon should be removed from the pho as it killed the taste. I drenched it in Hoisin and Sriracha to cover it up. Never went away but I drank a ton.

4Wj2OO6ziCbAxUrI5djFnQ.text: Love this place!!!! I went here for the first time tonight from a friends recommendation. I got the vegetarian pho, which was outstanding.  My friend got a rice dish and the pork spring roles and he loved them. They do not serve alcohol, but the best thing is you can bring your own for free! We brought a bottle of wine.

klHwVNIR0c3YSNISIIfY9w.text: Do not go here.... If you want an authentic experience, but even so the food is just blah over priced for what they give you for what I consider fast food, I ordered take out today and of course the man barely spoke English and so I thought "no prob" so I ordered in Viet witch we both spoke fluently, but I was very upset when I came home and my order was wrong. And to top that I tipped on Togo so I'm even more mad. And to top the whole thing off, whatever they gave us had 3 bites of meat on top of each order piled with a lb. of 25cent rice noodles and lb. of lettuce. None of witch looked good nor tasted good. Wish I would've checked my order before I left but the staff was so friendly I thought "how could they possibly fuck this up?", but boy was I wrong. NEVER AGIAN!!! and now I can't get the taste of ginger out of my mouth yuuuuuck. Moderation people.

Qs5F-uAN880ZfGiHBcCf1A.text: Newbies to this food but have always wanted to try this.  Great service spectacular food helpful staff all made this great inexpensive meal. I highly recommend this place.  I wish we had a place like this in my hometown.

lSfNVOCLIFsBuguPokhj3A.text: Very good food. Server/owner was super nice helped with ordering.   Have been back since and it is consistently good.

Zyx_UgOrySNYl2Fx9WtStw.text: Last time we were in Charlotte I dined with my parents at Vietnam Grille. We usually go to Saigon Palace, which is only a few blocks away, but this time we wanted to try something new. Vietnam Grille is fairly small and homey and is obviously family owned. It would be difficult to accommodate a very large group here but it is a nice and cozy place for a couple or family.  The menu is ranges from soups, noodles and rice dishes to traditional Vietnamese dishes and beverages. We tried the pictured house special vermicelli, which was very good - lots of picked carrots and radishes and tasty meat - as well as the seafood noodle soup. The soup didn't stand out as much as the vermicelli, but the fresh spring rolls were very good - one of my favorite foods! I don't think Vietnam Grille has the yellow pancake (banh xeo) we like so much on the menu. For that (and for large groups) I will keep going to Saigon Palace - or back to Vietnam - I hope to finally put some food photos from my SE Asia trip up soon! If you are in Charlotte Vietnam Grille is a solid choice for reasonably priced tasty food. I look forward to trying additional menu items on future visits.

ItDtUHTsorIieTsFXheCqQ.text: We went over a year in Charlotte before discovering Vietnam Grill, and that delay ranks as our #1 regret since moving here. It's easy to miss, the stand-alone-in-a-strip-mall-parking-lot facade hiding a hub of tasty cuisine with fresh ingredients.   For those who haven't been, it shares a section of South Blvd with more well-known staples such as Bill Spoon's BBQ and The Clock.   It looks like they've had a few bad reviews of late, but our visit today was as good as ever. We only go about once a month, but the servers remember us right away and it only took about five minutes from order to service - perfect for a quick lunch.   The Bun dishes, especially the grilled pork and grilled meatball varieties, are always terrific. If you're not familiar, Bun = room-temperature rice vermicelli, a few mixed veggies (including some greens), topped with your meat of choice. Their house sauce, served on the side, is a smoother, cleaner version of a fish sauce. There's no real reason *not* to use the entire thing, as well as some of the house made chili sauce, but feel free to try just a little to get started.   The Pho is my other favorite, particularly the brisket & flank steak combination. Other options include tendon, tripe and meatballs (different from those served on the Bun), but I personally choose to get as much steak as possible because I'm a simple creature. Fresh sprouts, jalapenos, and basil are served on the side to add to the hot, delicious broth at your leisure. Again, I see no reason not use everything, but maybe I'm just a glutton for goodness.   I've had their spring rolls, summer rolls, and salt-baked shrimp on random occasions and enjoyed them all. I'm not a big appetizer person, though, so it's more an issue of personal choice than worthiness of the dish.   For the dinner crowd, an interesting distinction: this place is BYOB, so plan accordingly. Daniel (@CharlotteBeer) is a better pairing suggester than I, and he thinks a Saison would be a great +1 for any beer lovers looking to drop in.   Finally, I love this place because our family always has a good time there. The servers and chefs have all checked in on us and our year-old son during our visits, including spacing the delivery of our dishes during the months when the little guy was feisty at the dinner table, thus allowing my Pho to be warm when I finally got to eat. Big ups to any place willing & able to accommodate patrons of all shapes, sizes, and ages.   There, now I'm hungry for another trip back to Viet-nomnom.

yoF5M8_4Aoo-dws2c7SUNQ.text: This whole in the wall has pretty good pho, though it isn't my favorite. I take my pho seriously and wish the broth here was a bit lighter with a more complex flavor profile.

LXa4RUPcOHkc4TlzdtUT1Q.text: If you are passing through or live near South Charlotte, this is the place to go for pho, rice wrapped spring rolls, or just a Vietnamese fix. I tried this place on a whim a couple months ago and have been drawn back several times for those tofu spring rolls.   I would highly recommend it based on the relaxed but high quality of service, top notch freshness, and price for what you get.

a7-DOPZdZbdbHnFK2-bcWw.text: Just ok.  Quite pricy.  $8.95 for a bowl of Pho.  I paid the extra $2 for more meat and really, was surprised at the lack of brisket and flank steak.  Would have considered that a "regular" order not the extra.  Clean place, fast service.  I was one of the first customers seated at 1130.  By noon there was a line out the door.    Got the fried spring rolls for $5.95.  Very dry and gummy.  Definately not the greatest.

lTcvzEL8iA49884hQWmscA.text: This place is so good. Their appetizers are always fresh and tasty and the waiter even gave me a history lesson on the origins of the ingredients! I had no idea that I would come hungry and leave educated.  Seeing as how I almost failed World History in high school, it just doesn't get any better!  My friend and I love coming here because the staff is so friendly and remember our orders!

NBiNT-r18ZsDsKgAg_gzAg.text: After reading the reviews on yelp we decided to visit during our business trip.  The service was great and the staff very friendly.  When I ordered, I asked which chicken entree would come with the Most veggies and it was r commended that I have the vegetarian plate and add chicken (I know, ironic).  When the food came out, it was a plate of garlic chicken with some scattered boiled spinach on the plate.  While the chicken was good, I was left underwhelmed and craving my veggies.  Maybe I need to stick to Thai for my veggies!?!  I just felt bad for the vegetarian who would order a plate of boiled spinach.   I would give it another try since all the reviews seem so positive.  Plus, I enjoyed the service.

Rh-M-51QclVSeLjfx99CjA.text: I will absolutely be returning here. Awesome food in a fast, casual setting. Plenty of parking. Decently priced. Big Menu. This is my go-to spot for Pho in CLT.   I'll be straight-forward, there aren't much fancy or special quirks to this place. I stopped in to order some seafood pho which was DELICIOUS and a massive portion. One bowl of soup could probably be shared amongst two people. They are generous with their portions and also were generous with the seafood. The food came out quickly and hot. Major comfort food. The veggies were fresh in both meals I tried.   You can bring the whole family here for a good, inexpensive dinner. This is definitely a goodie, and TRY THE PHO. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood Pho

ff_vJOg2Gtg3AdTS45dDFg.text: I've been on a roll this summer, trying out new foods and places as much as I can. I guess you can call it a "summer roll". But seriously, terrible jokes aside, I've seen plenty of good reviews for this place that my interested was peaked.   The pictures kind of persuaded my decision and I knew what I wanted going in. The staff working there was very friendly and fast, which was great. I showed our server a picture of what I wanted, she told me what it was and I went from there. I ordered some summer rolls to start. Then for my main dish, I ordered the pork and shrimp broken rice. It came with a salad on the side.   The summer rolls were okay, they had seemed to have more noodles than most of the ones I eat. But I still ate every bite. The shrimp and pork broken rice was very tasty and I really enjoyed it. It wasn't the best that I've had locally, but it was still good enough that I would order it again.   Overall, I had a great experience and I would recommend this place to anyone.

p8TPq64wqHfQroq7aNsogA.text: Love this place! Always so fresh and friendly service. The Mongolian beef is our favorite! That sauce is to die for!

IyjZXf0aKQIV53BoGDop_w.text: New owners, new decorations, but most importantly, new recipe. It was so bland it made me sad. Tasted like it was made with a dash of beef powder and boiled with lots of cinnamon sticks. I had to add all the condiments on with extra salt and extra fish sauce. Asked for chili oil on top of it. I hate bean sprouts so much but I added it in to fight with the nasty. Also got the fresh summer rolls. Sauce tasted straight up like peanut butter. Rolls had no flavors either. I don't think this new owner have any experiences with cooking. Service was great though, which earned a star. Sorry, I won't be back though. Bill was almost $40 before tip. Do yourself a favor and go down the road. There are two other Vietnamese restaurants that will make you happy.

Our server described what exactly was in the Pho and then some of the health benefits of eating these non-standard foods! It was a great experience and I hope to go back soon.

x7f79dSNBeM3pqUuKAcRwA.text: Spring rolls were very good and the pho was not bad. Broth was delicious. Great price too.

xyG2acQLyEkA0ByNxK8OFg.text: I had been here a very long time ago.  Today, we had dinner here and the flavor of the food was amazing.  I had a tofu dish with mixed veggies. It had the perfect amount of kick.  The tofu was crispy and so yummy.  For those of you who stick up your nose at the thought of tofu, I double dog dare you to come here to try it.  This restaurant is squeaky clean.  There is soft instrumental music playing that enhances the atmosphere.  It has a quiet vibe and would be really good for a date night place.   Several different people came by our table to see if everything was good. I am guessing one was the chef and one was the owner. There were a few servers.    Outstanding food.  Outstanding service.   If you're in south Charlotte, why drive to Lang Van when you have this as an option.   We are lucky to have such splendid Vietnamese restaurants in Charlotte!

WhZa01QycR9WQq-9UiS8qw.text: Vietnamese Grill was my first experience with Pho and spring rolls. I have no other experience to compare it too.   When I arrived I was a little iffy, but the restaurant had lots of good reviews.   I ordered the Pho Ga with fresh spring rolls.   The starters was fresh shrimp spring rolls with peanut sauce. Delishhhhh.....   It was so favorable and fresh. The Pho came with chicken, rice noodles, onions, and cilantro in a broth. The additives of freshness was a side of bean sprouts, mint, and jalapenos. Throwing the additives into the broth is what brought on the flavor.    I overall enjoyed my experience and look forward to going back.

nRjsdJWgVlj5ziCY1PSuRg.text: I've been on a quest to try all the Vietnamese restaurants in the Charlotte area and Vietnam Grille was not at the top of this list to try but I'm very glad we made a stop there.    The outside of the restaurant is not very appealing but wait until you step inside. The restaurant is so cozy and warm. It was definitely a comfort from the cold rainy day. The staff is very alert and inviting.   The food however is impressive. I ordered the Mi Hoanh Thanh and my friends ordered the Com Tam Suon - Tom Nuong and the Hu Tieu. There was a very pungent seafood smell when the food arrived but it quickly left. My soup was very delicious and the star of the dish was the wontons. They get bonus points because they give you a large portions and their prices are reasonable.    Through the years I've heard mixed reviews but today they really proved themselves and I will be definitely be a regular!!!

Xo2nzq4ugwwkGlBhv3oGtQ.text: I was on the road in Charlotte, with a little help from my Yelp App i was directed here. I wanted something good, but not too terrible for me. My only gripe, aside from closing at 9pm?  They don't serve beer or alcohol. But they are BYOB (for beer at least, the table next to me had a bunch.  Definitely plan to return here.

Their Pho is sub par but the rest is so amazing I can't give this anything less than 5 stars.  They have a deluxe appetizer sampler here that is pricey...but worth every dime.  We have gotten it as our whole meal ( split between 2 adults and a toddler).

bVSqifaeU6HFc2QYlrLiTg.text: I love me some Vietnam Grille! Every appetizer is great. Surprisingly I am not the biggest fan of Pho.  It's great for a cold day and Vietnam Grille does a darn good job of giving you a massive bowl without skimping on the protein.  Instead I am like sir mix a lot due to the fact that I come here for the Bun hun. I usually get the special well because it has everything ( beef, chicken, shrimp, and spring rolls) and the portion is enough for two meals.  The price point is great here ( about $10-$12) and on top of that it is BYOB.

Gzh4f5Y4nU1x3ZPkLafBrA.text: Hands down, the best pho I have ever had! I ordered a number 2 (spring rolls) and 37 (flank and brisket pho), and they were phenomenal. The owner made some recommendations for my next visit, so I will be trying the pork chop very soon. The broth was incredible with its aroma and taste, and nothing needed to be added to it. The restaurant was clean and the staff was very friendly. Highly recommended!

Look back in the kitchen, didn't have any Vietnamese cook but Mexicans. .not being racist. .

t49J3RZjbw7AZfXcQlo1hw.text: I lived around the corner from this place for over three years. A month before I moved to another neighborhood I finally stopped in. And I have regretted my misspent time since. I make no claims to be a connoisseur of Vietnamese food. Actually, until my visit, I can't recall ever eating it at all. However, top echelon in the category or not, this was some darn fine food. It is certainly a little bit more pricy than your average Chinese or Thai restaurant (not too bad though, I spent about $12 compared to $9 for Chinese or Thai). But it is also distinctly different. I got the #32 bun based on a recommendation. Good gawd it was was delicious!! Unlike some of there other options (Pho I believe) the Buns are not a soup. Deceptive to their English word, they are also not a bread dish. The Bun is actually a rice noodle dish with various meats and vegetables thrown in. Mine had shrimp, chicken and beef. Everything about it combined for a culinary awakening. I have since moved about 10 minutes further away but have been back for takeout a few times. The only thing that stinks is I'm not a huge fan of making u-turns and coming south you have to make a really bold one to get to the parking lot with a potential car screaming blindly over the hill into your passenger side door. Ignore that it looks like a cheap diner on the outside. The only thing that matters is food and this is well worth the trip.

TjudNBoeFMEVijNL569MAQ.text: Came here for lunch with a friend one day... and I guess my darn expectation ruined it for me again.  With an overall good review, I thought I would get better food.  The truth is, it's so forgettable that I forgot what I had.  I believe I had the seafood noodles in soup.  It's quite pricey for the little seafood I got in my bowl.    With the amount of Vietnamese restaurants in Charlotte, there are better options.  Amazingly the place was pretty packed for lunch.  Guess location location location.

Gs-YjatwnZlHRMWZ7itsLg.text: My wife and I wanted to try something new. A friend of mine told me I should try this place. I am so glad we went cause the food was amazing. I went back a week later with my friend and his wife. We really enjoyed the apps and we shared our entrees. Over all good food and good price.

KngCfxbplEzGvD7a5DMXxw.text: This place is amazing! The food was incredible and the service was quick with a very friendly staff. We had the lemongrass steak with broken rice and spring rolls and it was delicious!

4T0PPRmgJ_987ZG7A2piSw.text: I had been here once before, before they redecorated.  I was unimpressed with the quality of the cooking.  I had forgotten that visit and my boyfriend and I went today.  Once I realized I thought to go elsewhere, but then thought let's give it another try, maybe it's improved. The waitress seemed not to understand my order.  I wanted bun with spring rolls shrimp and pork.  It came with a 1 inch by 1/2 inch tiny piece of pork.  No kidding.  6 or so shrimp and a fried spring roll cut up.  That part was correct.  But, the dish lacked any really interesting flavors.  The spring rolls were solid pork inside.  Not my favorite.   I've tried this dish elsewhere and there are much better dishes there up on Shamrock Rd.  My boyfriend is a big fan of beef pho and likes it a lot there too.  But here he said it was very light on the meat, flavor was so so, not his favorite.  The new decorations make it prettier inside, the prices are fair, and other staff seemed very friendly.

gEalCmPvaMYEGllAwQjBEA.text: I've traveled and lived all over the world and by far, Vietnam Grille (VG) has the best Pho I've ever consumed. I've eaten here a handful of times (both dine-in and take-away) and VG's Pho is consistently amazing each and every time - even the next day for leftovers!!!

rmRt2elCaN3ij4FWUp88Fw.text: I usually stay at executive park and tend to look for odd eats when I travel. I found this little place last year and go back every time I'm in town now. Don't be afraid of the raw steak appetizer. It is fantastic. Sliced just thin enough to be wonderful. With cilantro and mint and topped with peanuts add some great crunch. Add a little sriracha to perk it up.  The #31 special Pho is the best. tendon, tripe, beef, pork in a great broth. the first time I visited they had brains as well, but I didn't specifically request it and this time, no brains. Still fantastic. $22 before tip to be completely stuffed with healthy, well prepared food. Can't beat that.

4YcJAzOPX6Dc3kvfEMcPYQ.text: This isn't your usual ghetto Vietnamese Pho place. There is an *actual* menu in plastic and everything. They also don't have 10 different kinds of pho meat toppings that most people haven't heard of... which is kind of unusual for all the Vietnamese places I've been to. And they speak good English, again, very unusual.  I liked the spring rolls. I liked the pho. But the problem is, I just wish there was more of everything and that it was cheaper. I want more noodles, more meat, more bean sprouts!   It's too hard to justify paying $9 for a tiny bowl when I know I can get a heaping bowl somewhere else for $6. I'd come back if I'm craving it, but I plan on checking out some other nearby options first.

t60ioV3UUKEyTJvgUqTviA.text: Seafood pho was amazing !!!!!! I will definitely eat here more often. Portion size was huge . When I walked in to pick up my food the place smelt like heaven

BGsG36WNRre9fNQM6IUIwg.text: I love love love their wonton dumplings and the pork stew. It's spicy goodness. I could honestly drink the thick sauce. They serve a good bowl of Pho, have yummy crispy spring rolls, and the prices are reasonable. I like that their menu differs significantly from Doan's right up the street, even though they are both Vietnamese restaurants. It gives me a reason to go to both!

3hF18zF0r6GeuIk9t7KbAQ.text: I was impressed by so many positive reviews, love Vietnamese and had to try it. Three customers at dinner time... hmmm. Servers meant well, but some cannot communicate in English.  Very disappointed, not impressed, won't return.  I have had much better.

cW33R0LgSLXNyzQlwQShlQ.text: Horrible service!  Owner won't serve me...it was 8:38pm....it won't allow me to give zero stars

EJmapS042p4MehntOd-OTg.text: Nondescript little restaurant that may not have the best pho in town but is definitely in the top 3. What makes this 5 stars is the tendon in their pho. Most places that have tendon in their pho usually toss it in as an afterthought; you get a few measly little  pieces. Just enough to piss you off. Not at Vietnam Grille! It's like having a never ending bowl of tendon soup. Big chunks of tendon; some slightly chewy with a nice resilience, other pieces just melt in your mouth.  Last time I was there I requested my pho with all tendon; it was fantastic. The owner came out to see who ordered it; probably wondered what kind of freak orders a pho like that. He asked if I had tried tripe; yeah back in the day Mom would cook up that mushy nasty  stuff. I was like thanks but no thanks. He bought out a sample and this tripe was much different. Not mushy and foul smelling like what my mother made, this tripe had a nice texture with a bit of snap to it and a neutral scent. It was something that I would try again and am glad the owner let me sample some. He was great and genuinely interested in his customers.  There are other things on the menu, including a raw meat dish that I plan to try. If it wasn't on the other end of town for me I would eat here more.

qCvsxxa0lWQj1s5vQ30Ueg.text: ---Brace yourselves, as this is a VERY long review----  Hanging out with other foodies in San Diego I was constantly dragged along on hunts for perfect pho. It was definitely a trend among the foodies to compare pho notes, finding the most bizarre and hidden vietnamese restaurants and bragging about it among other gourmands.   The fact is, I never really liked pho, my friends would ooh and ahh and suck down giant bowls of it. I'd do the same, thinking to myself, well this is good right? I just must not get it. Pho never really seemed all that special to me.  Having moved to the mountains of WNC, my cravings for vietnamese food have grown exponentially, not pho of course, but delicious spring rolls wrapped with lettuce and the like, maybe a bahn mi sandwich. The fact was, there are no vietnamese restaurants in Asheville, and you always want what you can't have.   On a recent trip to Charlotte I sought out the most accessible and highest rated viet restaurant, which just happened to be Vietnam Grille. I couldn't have been happier.  Open till 10, it fit right in with my schedule. Well lit, and open seating, I was pleased immediately upon entering. Wasting no time I asked for an order of crispy spring rolls. Delivered quickly PIPING hot, and amazingly crunchy, the spring rolls were like biting into little nuggets of heaven. A perfect blend of pork and shrimp.  When my server returned to take my order, I was torn between three items. The house special bun, the deluxe broken rice, and the pho. I didn't really want the pho though, it's just... that's what people get. I asked my server for his recommendation. He informed me that the pho was amazing. I winced, and flipped a coin for guidance.  Heads: Get the pho Tails: Get something awesome!  The coin launched into the air, and landed in my palm... heads. Fate had decided for me. It was time for the pho. Once again I was amazed at the speed in which my order was brought to the table. The pho came out steaming, beautiful. From the aroma it was instantly apparent that this was no standard bowl of pho. This was something special.  I got to the process I'd seen time and time again, tearing up the basil leaves, putting the meat under the noodles, adding the sprouts and lime juice. Just as I went to reach for the Sriracha a man came to our table, he looked at my bowl and said, "Before you use that, try it first" "People always ruin the broth before tasting what the chef has prepared"  I was taken aback, how could I be so rude? I instantly complied and brought a spoonful of the golden, transparent soup to my lips. To call it an explosion of flavor would be an overstatement, it was much more subtle than that. Tiny waves of flavor, layered together to form a perfect tapestry of delight rolled over my tongue. I had never tasted something so light, but full of character. Exceptional, something truly intelligent and delicious.   Suddenly it became apparent to me what pho was supposed to taste like, it's supposed to be like this. 3000 miles away from my friends in desperate search of the perfect bowl of pho, I was sitting right in front of it, and relishing every morsel of it. And to think that if I were to have added even a drop of Hoisin or Sriracha I could have tainted this perfect creation.  The man introduced himself as the chef and co-owner Ricky Lai. The rest of my meal was spent having a fantastic conversation with Mr. Lai about food, thought, practice, and the fact that Asheville is in DESPERATE need of a vietnamese eatery.   It was truly a pleasure to find and eat at the Vietnam Grille. It will surely become a source of pilgrimage when the cravings for vietnamese food become overwhelming.

2izWFGMlsMuG_K-Dkmv19A.text: Wonderful local restaurant. Super clean, friendly with very authentic and tasty food. Try asking for some recommendations. We tried the soup, dumplings and curry, all of which were great. Highly recommended.

m-218cmCZggC8pFobyGPOA.text: I was born and raised in hawaii and vietnamese food is quite common place there.  I definitely enjoyed the food here, very tasty and the staff is very friendly and welcoming.  I got to speak with the owner/head chef at one of my visits and was quite thankful for the business.  I've tried the Pho, the soup that they serve there, the summer (shrimp rolls), the noodle bowls, and one of the broken rice dishes. As you can see I've eaten there quite a bit, lol.  Still, you can't go wrong with a place that has good service and tasty food.

7XMfAZf-6KtD0JKYm4LJHg.text: Not fancy - but great food, good service.  Easy to find and to park.  Owner and his family work there - love the family feel - and they are focused on making this  great place to eat.   Food is authentic - so expect fresh vegetables, etc.   Everything is clean - service is great, food is great.    Ambiance - bit plain- but hey it keeps the prices down.    Try it - you'll like it.

iOUgjKrLE2tzdgf7bBYm7w.text: thanks to my fellow yelpers, we visited the vietnam grille today.  i have no point of reference when it comes to viet food, so i went in as a virgin...yay!  we found it very easily and was happy to see the YELP sticker on the door!  since i've never eaten viet food, i had a little trouble with the menu but the server was so sweet and answered all of our questions.  when we ordered the large appetizer where you can make your own spring rolls, she warned us that it was a lot of food, but our stomachs took over and said "that's okay".    well, she wasn't kidding!  it was a lot.  and we ordered other food as well! my dining partner ordered chicken/shrimp/meatballs and rice.  it looked delicious.  i ordered the pho.  it was excellent!  we even took most of that home because we filled up on the appetizer.  the food is absolutely delicious and i cannot wait to go back to try something else.

0866p3h8S-feolX3XIKhxw.text: I, myself, and vietnamese and have tried all dishes from all vietnamese restaurants. The pho here is delicious! and i've introduced a few friends here as their first time vietnamese food experience, and all of them love it and have told me they come back! The staff is awesome, they are never hesitant on trying to make your experience the best.   The location is the only thing that gives me this 4 stars. It's just I am SO close to getting in there to eat coming from Scaleybark on South Blvd and then the fact that I have to make an awkward u-turn into the apartments beside it sucks.  Other than the location, this is where I want to eat when I get pho cravings...and not close to family's home!

c66r1gERhBAXQPtnE6SrYQ.text: Food was outstanding and the service was great. All the others reviews were spot on for the positives of this place. Probably wouldn't have tried it on outward appearance alone but the inside was nice and very clean. The staff was friendly, attentive, and polite. Would definitely go back again!

zUJHQoG0mq5oRQa3TOPRZw.text: I've continued to frequent this place and the food and service remain five stars. Just good food at a decent price (get over it, you are in Charlotte, not in California or if you really want to compare and complain, HCMC).

wo91fMqiWefEsPG5p-g7YA.text: So, this place is awesome.  despite my high expectations from the rave reviews, they were still exceeded by this place.  dont let the weird location or the minimalist interior fool you, what this place emphasizes is quality - from the ingredients to the presentation, its all superb.  even with the quality ingredients, prices are similar to other vietnamese restaurants, maybe $1-2 more on certain dishes.  this immediately vaulted to my favorite viet restaurant ever, i highly recommend it for any fan of the cuisine.    App -Bo Tai Chanh - "beef tartar/carpaccio" as described by the chef.  marinated in a sweet citrus marinade, it was phenomenal. Entree -House Special Bun - bun is a staple of any viet restaurant.  had to try it.  simply put, its really good bun.  fresh, high quality veggies, shrimp, meats epitomizes the refreshing nature the dish should have.  Instead of Nuoc Cham sauce they have a house Nuoc Mam sauce, which is sans chili peppers and is a little sweeter.  still very delicous -Pan fried Rice Noodles - special of the day.  very good, not at all oily, served with a good helping of sauteed veggies.  not too much to say, was delicious and i have lots of leftovers.   BONUS!! -pho sample - if you like speaking to owners/chefs, definitely go at an off time because he likes to come out and talk.  my table was the only one there and he chatted us up quite a bit.  he guided us through the beef tartar, talked a little bit about banh mi, and then he INSISTED that we try the pho and brought out small bowls.  it was great pho-nomenal; he explained how he uses various aromatics, not just star anise, to make the broth.  cool conversation, and i am definitely getting the pho next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. menu1
Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. menu2

myx-FHVAgARX9hzBPHBx-A.text: First I want to express how truly friendly everyone  was to my wife and I & especially our son.  Great family experience!  Now on to the food.  Fresh great tasting plus added benefit of the owner showing us the best way to eat our meal so we experienced all the flavor.  Would recommend for a nice family meal or casual business dinner.  We will be back next trip to Charlotte.   BTW try the spring rolls and. Pho

twcyZr8O0aW7vg79vOv7VQ.text: Great food.  Love the Pho with meatballs.

4hjERsO9Y4zltlmfgRNo6w.text: Another perfect 3.5 in my book.  Very good pho.  Beef broth just rocks.  I had the sirloin and meatball combo.  The meatballs left a little to be desired, but the soup overall was very good.  Dumplings to start, were very good as well.  I would have given it 4 stars if they had tapioca pearls for the smoothie (tongue in cheek).  Ha.  Good place.

uruSP_cV7Bedzx6S4TKZRg.text: Have eaten here several times now and have never been disappointed.  Good consistent food.  Another great yelp find..

LnU5J5_11AImBjfiE5oxfw.text: Ricky and his family keep the best Vietnamese in town low key, top quality and with a Midas touch. His Pho is from scratch, meats of top quality, and attention to detail great. If you are lucky he will pause from his passion of cooking and come and greet you with genuine charm. He could not get a higher recommendation on his value for the cost either.

GPpBWZjjN6HuFv5niAMjAg.text: Great little lunch place. Small, friendly, clean. I can only speak to the Vermicelli, but it's delicious.

5-Hwjr12VphsC4zEg29iqQ.text: Best pho and fresh rolls in Charlotte hands down. Owner is always friendly and the staff is attentive and always makes sure your glasses are full. Take out is equally as good!

YynOi_O_fM2QQj4wPu2K9w.text: so far, this is the best vietnamese food i have had in charlotte. my sister introduced me to this place.  initially, we had problems finding it again since it is in a rather obscure strip of south blvd.  the food is freaking delicious! i got the "make your own" spring rolls. my sister showed me how to do them and then the waitress came back to show me how but i had already figured it out. plenty of food for the money but i wished they would have given me more herbs. i am sure i could have asked for more and next time, i will.  the ambiance was ok. pretty standard vietnamese place. one of the tables had a crying baby but i can't really blame the restaurant for that.  friendly staff, lots of parking, good prices, and lots of healthy options for food.  i will be back!

QyHUfOT3-5Y112i_klaq2A.text: This place is spotless, super friendly but most of all the food is excellent. Great pho, I highly recommend it.

0zQ-DkvqESua-kA9bx67xw.text: I went here for dinner recently.  I had the raw beef appetizer, which was quite good.  The pho was about average, nothing exceptional.  The service was very good overall and very friendly.

zit6w36VdaLp04kWwuCreg.text: Great pho!  I had 27, rare steak and well-done brisket.  It was great. My wife had 35, pork vermicelli, which she found good but not great.  The best part, however, was the appetizer, the meatballs. Great meatballs and fresh ingredients to make you own wraps. Look forward to going again.

IMd_h1M6PRWOf4_OdKJ4bg.text: I had the tofu spring rolls and tofu dumplings for apps. Lemongrass shrimp over broken rice for an entree. Pretty good - healthy food. Still felt hungry however. Would like to try again. I feel like I could do a better job of ordering next time - perhaps a soup bowl with noodles would be in order. I don't think that they serve beer which is unfortunate.

L5NP00n2IoaL2UVtnhjRQQ.text: I'm a big fan of Vietnamese food, and this is my favorite spot in Charlotte. The space doesn't look like much, it is in a former fast food building, but the owners are super friendly and the food is really great. My usual is the vermicelli bowl, and the spring rolls are divine.

Mb_bYaG8F8zM6jng7ap3Hg.text: We went here because everyone was raving about the pho. My other half ordered the pho tai while I got the pho tai bo vien. I would have to agree with some reviews that said that they used too much cinnamon and star anise. Also, they were a little heavy handed with the MSG. The meat was a little over cooked liked they boiled the meat in the broth pot first then add it to the bowl. I should have noticed that everyone around us ordered bun. Maybe next time, if we go back, we will order one of the grill plates. Hence, Vietnam GRILLE.

ueDG8_nw5fzQg0dfiyw7Ag.text: Good food & friendly staff! A smallish place with a lot of choices besides soup which is nice. Good for business travelers as they take American Express and you won't feel weird eating alone here. Both dishes I ordered were good and arrived quickly, I would go back when in the area.

VgZANnRYOjHWAlA5bk7XqQ.text: I wanna bathe in their pho. It's that gotdang good.  Overall A

kx-v7eSI_BzHsN2oel0ljA.text: Amazing!  My family has been here too many times to count.  Our go to - Pho.  Hands down the best ever.  I've taken family that have been overseas and they agree - best Pho.  Get the classic or the seafood Pho.  Huge portion - warning. The broken rice assortment with chicken, shrimp, meatball things is wonderful too.  The shrimp wraps are deceptively simple but tasty - mint, shrimp, rice noodles and green onion.  Wow! My kids like the meatball things - don't know what spices they use but it's delicious. BYBO, which is rare and a nice change.  The owner Ricky is a wonderful man - greets everyone and talks to the patrons. Worth the drive for delicious, fresh food.

wE1CmrOKp1X_ks3GjHOUVg.text: The food and service was excellent!  I was most intrigued by the genuine care the owner has for his business and his employees.  I've read several reviews about how people have been told to never come back and what those people fail to realize is...it is because you don't know how to tip and you don't care either!!  Upon my visit to the restaurant I witnessed that happen...IT WAS THE BEST THING I'D EVER SEEN!  Learn to tip people...18% or more...respect people that work in the food service industry.  If you don't want to tip, get takeout!  More people should stand up to non-tippers.

w9fMvEj7svo05Qx7V2HNyg.text: Oh my gosh. I don't usually write review updates, but I just have to. I have to bump it up to 5 stars. The service has improved, which was my original reason for the star deduction. I have also become more fond of the decor and the cleanliness of the place. But more importantly, I must reiterate...  Best. Pho. In. Charlotte.  I went there for lunch yesterday with a bunch of friends, and 5/6 of us ordered some variant of pho. We were briskly served two big plates heaping with the trimmings. Stomachs were filled. Faces were smiling. Bowls were emptied.  Service was snappy and attentive. The chef came to speak with us and was quite cordial.  I can't get enough of it. I am eating the leftovers as I type. I'll be back again soon. Check out my previous review for more of the deets!

QLv3Kr1LneNwBnnHKGb-2Q.text: Down South Blvd, right off the road is a really cool little place called Vietnam Grille. It is a crowded ( which shows how good it is) little clean restaurant. Yesterday in Charlotte it was windy and damp and cold-how perfect for Pho! We went at Lunch time when it was very full but got a seat very quickly and  our order was taken in perfect time. We ordered some Crispy Spring Rolls and #26 which is the Beef Pho. Spring Rolls were delicious, all the sauces on the side of table went on to my plate to make a delicious dipping sauce. The Soup arrived --Huge Bowl! Filled with a delicious broth and noodles and beef and then all the extras on the side to add, the bean sprouts, Thai basil, cilantro, lemon, and jalapenos! It was piping hot and delicious..You have to try it ..I will be going back again and again!!

cUW3EBKN-VgGxDn8sK-mOQ.text: We Come here at least once a month. Probably more like 2 to 3 times a months. The Pho is some of the best I've had in Charlotte. I also highly recommend #33 the house special bun.

vJ4ngGmxgmx_03vBAjXrgg.text: Pho was delicious. A little on the pricey side for a bowl though. Two people each ordered pho and a drink and it was $25. But everything about it was spot on so I'll be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Looove their pho

mVIzxD1-VsP0wqOiAH-y8A.text: First of all... great food!  Would get 5 stars if they served alcohol.  Had the Seafood Pho and had a hard time deciding if the ingredients were best... or, the broth.  For my palate, I added a little chili sauce to spice it up.  All the ingredients tasted fresh.  The shrimp were definitely not pre-frozen.  Service was great.  Menu is easy to read and describes the offerings well... which should be a plus for those new to Vietnamese cuisine.  Would HIGHLY RECOMMEND to anyone with a cold or flu.  The pho will fix 'ya.  I'll be back and ready to try more of this place's great food.

gbTrKZlzqPZ_Hg1-Bl7RLg.text: Slowly, I'm eating my way through all the Vietnamese restaurants in Charlotte.  After recommendations from two people in just as many days to check out Vietnam Grille, I moseyed my way there to check it out during dinner break.    Definitely not seedy like another I recently visited, VG is bright and clean.  Tiny, and packed with people on a Tuesday evening.  People were bringing in their own bottles of wine, and very clearly having a good time.   Ultimately, the bun is just delectable here.  Noodles not gummy, cooked just right.  Plenty of grilled flavor in the chicken and meatballs.  Lots of crunchy peanuts and scallions, but where was the cilantro? I usually can't get enough cilantro in my Vietnamese food, but surprisingly, I didn't miss it in this dish.  Good sign.   Liked how fresh tasting everything was, and the little details like the extra long chopsticks, and carrot slivers, cut with a ripple pattern. The iced tea is nice and strong, served with lime.  Biiiig plus in my book. Nothing worse than weak tea.   TIP: The service is really friendly, and the dishes came out lightening fast.    Next on my list it to try the pho!

5FHY_lC8wO9hTafLz-pspA.text: First time here. We were a little iffy about going in because there were no cars, but after reading some really great reviews we finally decided to try it. Customer service was ok. We were the only customers here. My little brother ran out of water twice, but they never came to refill our water unless asked. It would have been a 5 star since they were nice, but the place wasn't busy and they never checked up on us unless we get their attention, therefore the overall customer service is a 3. We got three pho dac biet and one pho meatball, out of the 4 we made 2 of them small for the 2 kids. The pho is so and so, the taste was a little off.  When the bill came out,  we were charged at full price for the two small pho which was not worth at $10.95 each. Had we known this, we would've just gotten a regular bowl of pho for the two kids instead of asking for two small bowl of pho. The two regular pho is not worth for what it is. All the pho had very few meats. The variety of vegetables/herbs was very little, there were only basil, lime, jalapenos, and bean sprout.  Overall for the taste of pho and the variety of herbs/vegetable, I would give it a 3.

pGdwHDU09SY_uZCT9g9swQ.text: I LOVE this place. Only been there twice, but everything I've had has been exceptional. Crispy spring rolls, fresh pork & shrimp spring rolls, pho, grilled squid with vermicelli noodles - all absolutely delicious. Cute little place, nice but simply decorated. The staff is courteous and attentive. Currently one of my fave restaurants in Charlotte!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled squid with vermicelli noodles - amazing!!

ShZ6wFpk-umJBbFp16wtJw.text: Have been here many time before.  I went there couple of days ago I ordered the chicken stew with rice.  It was very good have a good amount of kick to it.  Will make this a once in while dinner spot..

IAtyUN_1Tg6ond6xmxTk9w.text: We tried every pho place in Charlotte and Vietnam Grille is the clear winner. This is one of maybe two restaurants where we're regulars. The pho is great and the staff is SUPER attentive and friendly.   I always get: #8 Char grilled pork rolls. Always. #30 Pho with meatballs and flank steak. And extra noodles if I'm feeling frisky. Too hot for pho? #35 Char grilled pork bun. Pro tip: It's never too hot for pho.

gsPN57rMrenhhJPQp9d6Kw.text: Vegetarian pho is chock full of veggies & incredibly flavorful. Just what the doctor ordered for any cold/rainy/hungover day. Environment is a little lacking, but nothing that would keep me from coming back.

RYq7ATjtl_o9TR_LArekeg.text: We had a great experience here! The inside of the restaurant is clean, and the staff was really working hard to keep it that way--one lady was dusting the blinds while we were there. How often do restaurants bother?  The food was a great price and wonderfully flavored and cooked. We are not familiar with Vietnamese food but really enjoyed our experience here with dumpling appetizers, seafood pho, and a mixed rice entree. We'll be back!

U1bmTGGf9z1qO7tMGOeudg.text: I enjoy Vietnam Grille, their dished are well prepared. I've never had to wait for lunch or dinner so that's a big plus! Their pho is good and their service is quick! I haven't had anything bad in this place.

cCH45FlqT9IXhL03wJfquw.text: This place is strange.  It's great though.  The first thing you notice when you walk through the door is the small army of wait staff standing with military precision to the left of the door, hands clasped behind their back, waiting to attend to your every need.  The interior was furnished in a plain and forgettable, but clean and pleasant manner.  Pretty much every other small, unassuming ethnic restaurant with uninspired decor you have ever been inside.  Who cares, though.  We are quickly seated and began poring over the menu.    My better half knew exactly what she wanted; I was not very hungry and had a lot of trouble choosing.  After much deliberation over the merits of various dishes and sauces and meats, we ordered.  I ordered ground pork fried spring rolls, the lady ordered pho.  Our food came out so fast I suspected telepathy, or perhaps a long heat lamp bar full of two hour old pre-prepared food.  As we dug into our meals these heartless thoughts were abolished.  My "appetizer" was huge, five spring rolls and a plate piled high with vegetables of the green, leafy, cruciferous sort.  The pho was a generous portion, but not too big.    Throughout our meal we never seemed to have a dedicated waiter, we were simply waited upon by whoever was available.    This efficiency based method of serving was strange, but... efficient?  Upon requesting our check it appeared at the table in about twenty seconds, no kidding.   Based on one visit, I would certainly return again.  The prices were fair, the food was excellent, and the service was great.   Don't base your verdict on the unassuming look of this joint, go eat there.

C7E41_8aeUME1DCn-Lk6lg.text: The Pho train continues. Know this place to be one of the most highly revered in town when it comes to authentic Vietnamese, and I'm happy to jump on the bandwagon of believers. It's quaint, very simple inside and located off of South Blvd. Headed north on South Blvd, it's easy to turn in really quick. Located in the parking lot of Sports & Fitness.   The rice paper rolls - best I've had in Charlotte. Very thin vermicelli, mint leaves were spectacularly fresh, crispy tofu and the peanut sauce was just wonderfully flavorful.   Had to sample the pho, per usual at any vietnamese eatery, and I was thrilled. Simply put, it's just perfect. Savory and smooth broth, spiced well, filled with crunchy scallions, bean sprouts, fresh jalapenos, vermicelli, and a nice helping of thinly shaved beef.   Two entrees and rice paper rolls for only $22. We'll be back really freaking soon. So good.

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pho with meatballs and sliced pork
Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie Spring Rolls

h9xYqhxiq8-JTM_iB9Q9VA.text: Absolutely love this go-to, under the radar, neighborhood spot. Service is great, food comes out fast. Everything I've tried has been delicious. I've never been disappointed, have been going here for years. #30 is my favorite pho in Charlotte to date.

AyTsaUDLY6QmY0-enuzQWQ.text: Terrible customer service from the cashier on staff yesterday afternoon. She did not take the time to listen to what I wanted. Due to the language barrier and her terrible listening skills, she did not explain clearly they were completely out of vegetarian soup for the remainder of the time they were open. I asked her for soup and told her that was all I could eat and she directed me to the back of the menu and said these. To my understanding she was pointing to all soup options which is what I told her I wanted initially. I placed an order and when i received it, to my surprise  there was no soup at all. I asked her why did I not get soup? She began arguing and yelling at me in front of the rest of the customers in the Resturant. I had to tell her several times there is no need to argue and as a business owner you should make sure you understand what your customer is asking for. Instead of focusing on making a sale. She Told me I would have to keep it even though I have dietary issues because they weren't paying for it. Which is why I informed her I only wanted soup initially. Fortunately there was a very kind and reasonable business man that worked there. He resolved the issue and apologize and gave me my money back. He was aware that she did not explain well because she could barely speak English. Note of advise put someone at the register that is familiar with customers etiquette and knows how to speak and understand English well. It could have been the stigma and stereotypes they apply to all Blacks is why she treated me that way but there was no respect at all from her and she needs to take a back seat if she can't treat all customers the same.

PnUdf0UqFy7l0g3qW56vtw.text: We went in for lunch on our way to the airport and had a wonderful experience. Friendly as can be, beautiful fresh ingredients and generous servings. We shared a big cabbage salad with cucumber and a light dressing with toasted almonds and peanuts. I had the Vegetarian Pho which was amazing and my dining companion had a chicken and rice noodle bowl. We shared a pot of oolong tea. We were both completely satisfied and left feeling great. I think we started a new CLT tradition.

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable pho. Like a big bowl of medicine. So delicious.

G_KZ4M-93YHUygfz9CWeyg.text: I've been here twice. Last time we were here, the food was horrible especially the pho and the fried spring rolls. I want to give it a second try, so I came again, pho was a little better this time, but nothing special, definitely not worth the price. Also there don't have fried quails on their menu, something I always order when I go to a Vietnamese restaurant. Will not return again. One thing that's good about this place is that the service is good, the dining atmosphere is probably a little better than the other two Vietnamese restaurants on South Blvd. They also take Amex, which is a plus.   Compared to the other two Vietnamese restaurants on South Blvd. I like Seigon Palace's pho the most. Doan second, this place the least.   In terms of best pho in Charlotte, I vote for Pho Hoa on central Ave. The fried spring rolls and fried quail there are also delicious.

4HphIN8aVnS2m7WIIpqW8A.text: It had been a while since eating here, my girl and I split some fresh rolls that were excellent. She had #33 and the pork stew that was very good. The staff was very nice and professional.

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork stew was very good over white rice
Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. #33

1SyXGuYSFRD58ne1PIxldA.text: We had a very bad experience with this called authentic Vietnamese cooking. It is not! We ordered should-be-Vietnamese authentic dishes : shrimp salad, sour fish hot pot and chicken lemongrass pepper . All came out from poor to abusive qualities and nowhere can be called authentic Vietnamese cooking . Never come to this place again!!!

EN98IeiHEPOAS3TQ5B6ZKA.text: Yum!  I have never had a bad meal here... And in the short time I have lived in Charlotte I have been here quite often... It's that good!  But to be totally fair I usually get the same things... Vegetarian pho, veggie rice paper rolls and the crispy spring rolls... Man I am hungry just thinking about it!  I have sampled other items but those are my favorite... The soups are so delicious and served traditional Vietnamese style with fresh basil, cilantro ,crunchy sprouts, lime etc.  don't come here for the ambience or decor... It's not fancy but the food is delicious and really that's why you need to come here.  Service is always fast, although it does get crowded for lunch during the week.  Oh and the soups are literally 2 meals!  I have never been able to finish in one sitting and I can eat a lot!

3-Ou7BUxBtUAsyFGw6_0wQ.text: This place was delicious! Loved the shrimp bun noodle bowl. Will definitely be back with my kids as I think there are lots of reasonably priced and filling meals for all ages. Hidden gem in this multicultural corridor.

H5h82SOQHaJSrIllDg_tdw.text: This place obviously changed their hours and didn't update anything else except the door on their business. Last time I came by, they were closed randomly. Ok, I understand things happen and it's necessary. No problem. However, now they are closed on Sundays and didn't bother to update their answering service or information online. Annoying.

jLYOuKh0iOxbZ-5PrvhE2A.text: Been to many pho places and tasted a lot spring rolls but this one is a keeper. Had the bun cha gao n it was tasty with a deep fried skin that was crunchy yet chewy. Yum!

8fWlZmlEb6uBltcvf5OGwQ.text: The service was nice. I believed the  owner was very nice to his customers. Food were fine. We had some rolls along with our entree. The rolls were not good representation. We ordered pho and broken rice. They were good, but we had better.

photos.caption: Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. New Nuong Cuon

GuXHASKBU7WjgAyFtp5kJg.text: My friend and I meet up here quite often for lunch. It's a great place to catch a quick bite. The staff are very friendly and quick. The food is always fresh and delicious. I usually ordered the fried rice and the steamed dumplings. The inside is very clean as well. You will definitely love this place!

vXMVLdGy8gwMECbOFnB0XQ.text: My boyfriend and I ate here for the first time on Valentines Day. It was perfect for so many reasons. Did not have to make any reservations, walked right in and got a table, BYOB (in our case champagne this evening) and the food was great.   The food here was so good and so fresh. I had a dish with rice noodles, loved it. My guy had the broken rice. Also amazing. I can't wait to go back and try the pho.

sbw182-VhB7Ie1R_WEnVWA.text: Vietnam Grill was good but nothing spectacular. I landed in Charlotte and even though it was borderline 96 degrees out, I was craving some pho. A search on the Yelp app directed me to VG.  Friendly, FAST service. I had shrimp rolls (sans pork); they were cool and crunchy and fresh but the dipping sauce sprinkled with crushed peanuts was underwhelming. The pho tai was steamy hot and flavorful, the meat tender and still slightly rare, and it came with plenty of fresh toppings. However, maybe it was a fluke thing or maybe I am just a complete piggy, but my soup didn't contain very many noodles - in fact, the most scanty portion I've ever received with pho. I almost wanted to order a side of extra noodles to dunk in the broth.   Price was $15 - the pho was $10. This was the most expensive pho I've ever ordered, and the smallest portion (then again, it IS Charlotte, which is just a pricier area). Neither the pho nor the rolls blew me away with deliciousness or value, so I would try other Vietnamese places first in Charlotte before I would venture back to VG.

ILH8DP7OcWazAR0Usbp4xQ.text: I've been a few times, and always a great experience. Super friendly staff and incredible food.

2y2XL0oSOLAC1KZL1UKEGQ.text: My favorite restaurant to eat at hands down. Always consistent, great staff, big flavor. The servers always are happy and are happy to make modifications if you need them. There food is amazing- great pork chops- Pho etc. My friends and I love coming here and it's BYOB.

7ektdw-BE-TVIh0J65aJMw.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. The food is incredible. The menu is ver Veg-friendly. If it's your first visit, definitely start with the appetizer sampler. The portions are huge, so we usually get a few things to share with the table.  Rick, the owner/chef always comes out to chat with you.  The ambiance is perfect for having dinner with friends and even great for a date night.  The best part is, it's BYOB. We usually take a bottle or two of wine (depending on how many people we have with us) and there is no corking fee! This review does not do Vietnam Grille any justice.

hgPx9ibBN1_vtkxQniKX5w.text: The staff are very friendly. Immediately when we entered, we were greeted by 3 different people. They offer great service too.  Each restaurant has different versions of Pho so we like to compare. We got the veggie pho and it had celery in it which is a different twist. We also wanted to try a bun dish as well. I didn't expect it to come out cold. It was tasty, but not satisfying (mainly due to me wanting something hot). Although I have to say that the grilled shrimp were very delicious! Their chili and oil condiment was very spicy and a very dark red.  The space size is medium; I'm sure it can fill up fast on a busy night. The heat system was broken so they had a little space heater in one section. I wish they would have set us next to it.

Photo of Vietnam Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp bun dish

7LvGBBRATfc7ylKVLe9Zhg.text: I've eaten here three times and for the first two times I ordered pho and summer rolls. The summer rolls are a little on the skinny side and don't have much flavor, in fact, you need to soak it in sauce to make it taste like anything. The pho is solid, the broth is tasty and the meat cuts are the way they should be. But as I was slurping my pho during my second visit, I noticed that most people around me were having vermicelli bowls. So on my third visit I ordered the rice noodle vermicelli with char-grilled pork and a spring rolls, and it was excellent. The fish sauce mixture added the right amount of savoriness to the dish, the pork hit the right salty-sweet notes, the spring roll was crispy and the veggies added a nice freshness and crunch. This is my go-to place for rice vermicelli bowls and it should be yours too.

5oI8bFomShuh14lmUQ-1Vw.text: I ordered the pho dac biet and it wasn't the greatest. The broth had an unusual taste to it although the meat portions were just about right. The service was friendly but it was a little strange to have the waitress come by 3 times refilling our water when we barely drank any of it. It got to the point where the water overflowed from our cups. Friendly staff but pho could be better

YVy9HZ8Nui0_ELpUSZ46JA.text: Got buon thit nung.. yummy!! I love the way they  cook it!! and unlike most asian restaraunts, I dont feel tired after i finish eating!! Love this place!

cpQ0MUZfkSjrPUVvFpc1fA.text: Another great little place to grab some yummy pho. The owner is also the chef and the pride shows through in the other dishes as well ( try the bun). While perhaps not as over the top service as Lang Van, the food is top notch and the service good. This is not a fancy place , but a simple little place with good food and good service.

6Sjrj5prXDlA_BCVF4VyjA.text: OMG it's a total party in my mouth, Vietnam Grill is amazing! If ever in Charlotte, NC make it a definite stop!!

zI5rO5M4Sv3_b0g8-9q6yA.text: My first time eating Vietnamese food and this was wonderful!   The staff was friendly and very accommodating.  The food was delicious! There were 10 in our party and everyone loved it!

a2TK1o69Y1BLInrYTB5aBw.text: The grilled pork bun is, hands down, my favorite dish in Charlotte! Vietnam Grill is spotless and the staff is so friendly.

JDXv0jw6HGaTB22PkK8rew.text: On some of the unbearably hot days we have I sometimes wish the temperature would magically drop so I can enjoy a bowl of pho from this place.  Its just not the same eating something that hot in the summer.  Although the bun is really good and refreshing, I just really enjoy pho.  Specifically I just go for the sliced flank steak pho, and for the bun I go with the char-grilled pork.   You can tell everything is fresh.

MZDoFqBu32JnmZBcaouugQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE vietnam grille!!!!  the food is absolutely amazing and the staff is extremely accommodating and friendly.

O87p3LLY5uizbw4WRmiCTA.text: I believe I stated in another review for a Vietnamese restaurant that phos generally tasted all the same. However, this restaurant's pho is actually not as good as the others, for several reasons, including poor ingredient and other sanitary reasons.   I'd have to say that this place has pretty decent service. The owner likes to chat the customers up and is generally extremely cordial. Sometimes he does talk a bit too much because most of the times I eat out with a friend to chat with them, not the restaurant staff. He'll just keep talking and talking about how he's from Philadelphia and his experience and other things, and I can't really tell him to stop talking because I don't want to be a d!ck about it.   Their fresh spring rolls are pretty good. They do fill it with a good amount of pork and shrimp. Can't really get these things wrong.   Moving on to the pho. They're quite stingy with their sides. I usually get the combination pho. The raw flank beef they use is not very good quality. It tastes very... gritty. It just tastes very different from all the other phos I've had before. Does not taste as quality as others. The broth is decent.   One time I was there with my family. The four of us all got pho. My sister's pho came with a hair in it. We returned it for another one. Here's the kicker... They brought the bowl into the kitchen, and not 20 seconds later they came out with another bowl of pho. This time without the hair. My mom didn't say anything for fear my sister would waste her bowl of pho knowing that they probably just took out the hair and brought the bowl back to us (she's only 12 and a very picky eater). Needless to say, we haven't gone back since and probably never will again. The owner is a nice guy though.

RlmA7bHwO33GfMeeXMuXwg.text: This place is great. One of the best Vietnamese places I've ever had. I was skeptical when I pulled up because the place is really pretty unimpressive from the outside and is located in a gloomy area of town. But I've learned better than to judge a book by its cover. When I stepped inside everything was clean and modern looking and the hostess took care of me right away. I ordered the spring roll (unfried pork / shrimp) and the beef and meat ball Pho with extra rare beef on the side. The spring roll tasted fresh and crisp with a hint of mint. The Pho was sensational. It was on the spicy side (which I like) and the broth was excellent with a very rich flavor. The quality of the meat was also excellent. I'd love to go back again and highly recommend Vietnam Grille.

pnihMeQgKdDMEn-YGVlOMQ.text: The restaurant itself isn't much to look at but I'm very familiar with Vietnamese food and theirs was excellent. Service was great as well. Definitely will be back and urge everyone to try it!

vxAb8hQkfnlz9GUWGz9eVQ.text: For the first time trying Vietnamese food I was really impressed. Everything was fresh and the service was excellent. The location isn't great but I guess that's what makes finding these places so exciting. I would definitely recommend this place to someone interested in trying something new.

j0Y-YJhD-sPJ3Jp5RnKAoQ.text: This was my first time eating Vietnamese food and I wasn't disappointed at all.  My husband ordered an iced coffee and I quickly followed suit.  When it arrived, I was pleasantly surprised by how good it was.  I am used to very strong coffee so when I go out, it's hard to find coffee that I like but this one was simply amazing.  I decided to try the Pho with meat and meatballs and my husband ordered the Pho with meat and tripe.  I loved the basil leaves that they give you to add to your meal and thought the broth was pretty good.  The meat was tasty but the meatballs weren't that great.  If you decide to order the Pho, I would recommend that you try it with something other than the meatballs.  My husband enjoyed his bowl of Pho as well.  We will definitely be going back here sometime soon!

qRxiiY2Cd8UeDottRSFuag.text: Our friends took us to this place and I can't thank them enough for introducing us to Vietnamese cuisine and from the reviews here, the best Pho anywhere in Charlotte!

eXe1g9puJnWFkZvu9VtREQ.text: I certainly can't consider myself to be a vietnamese cuisine expert, but if Vietnam Grille is any indication, I'm a huge fan!  Nestled in a inconspicuous corner shopping center off South Blvd, you have to look closely or you'll drive right by it.  Upon entering, I was immediately impressed by the hustle and bustle of the small restaurant during a weekend lunch and the tables filled with fresh vegetable dishes.  We started with the tofu rice noodle rolls - simple, chilled, and served with a tasty peanut sauce.  Then we shared two entress - vegetarian pho and the shrimp cabbage salad.  I've never had pho before, but will definitely be ordering it again.  The savory broth was filled with fresh vegetables and tofu and served with a side of bean sprouts, thai basil, and jalepenos.  The shrimp salad was a nice contrast with crisp cabbage, jumbo shrimp, and a citrus-fish sauce dressing.  Our party of two left with leftovers for an additional meal and a price tag less than $25.

pXxoZKmttw2FG7zotxHvpg.text: Might have just found our new favorite Vietnamese restaurant! Pho was tasty and a huge portion! The dumplings were amazing!! Can't wait to go back to try more!!

6jX-jZq6ps3jULb2FlpSyA.text: I went back for a 2nd visit, given it is pretty close to the airport.  The pho noodle bowl was still as good as I remember.... Lots of meat and tasty broth.  I didn't get a MSG overload this time either.   The mistake was ordering a non-pure Vietnamese dish - shrimp w/ spring vegetables.  The dish had plenty of shrimps, but not very tasty.  The veges (Chinese Choi Sum) was depressing.   The thing I like most here is the food comes out quick and hot.  The waiter got my order wrong but upon pointing it out, they cooked up the correct dish within 2-3 min.

Vt8_TejSLaNi44QaEV3N2Q.text: I just ate here for the first time and it was amazing in everyway. I had Pad Thai extra spciy and a reasonable bottle of wine with a friend. Service was friendly and attentive, restaurant was clean and inviting. I would definately recommend to others!

HtpEx--1J_sOb3bFWF8XTg.text: My kids and I enjoyed eating here. We all ordered Pho. The smallest size was more than enough for my kids to share. I really liked that the server knew to bring me a laddle making it easier to split my kids bowl. The soup was hot which I mention because I have been in some places and the soup was not hot enough and the noodles remain in clumps. The broth had a nice taste and service was great keeping our drinks filled. I often have my children with me and if they generally like the food thats a good sign. They both have eaten pho in many places and really enjoyed the soup here. When in the area we will definately visit again.

VL9-KREAONmaySxgWtisEA.text: Vietnam Grille is located on South Blvd in a non-descript building that would be easy to miss.  Inside you'll find a very clean and bright dining area with friendly staff that are very polite and helpful.  There is a wide array of dishes to choose from: dumplings, spring rolls, grape leaves stuffed with pork, broken rice dishes, noodle dishes, and pho.  I got the broken rice house special in order to sample a good range of what was offered.  It included spring rolls, meatballs, chicken and shrimp and was delicious.  I was really impressed by the presentation - it is nice enough to be a dinner place and not overpriced.  You could get away with spending a little under $10 for your meal but most likely will be at about $15.  I'm looking forward to visiting again soon!
